column4: Most Canadians will have learned about Signal Hill and Marconi in school, so it was a treat to visit this historic place. Even more interesting was learning the back story about the government's efforts to bring Marconi to St. John's, as well as the history of the construction of the building. A great view of the coastline as well.
Very short distance from downtown, and worth the walk or drive. A free attraction and free parking, and fantastic view of the city and the ocean. St. John's best hiking path but only in fair weather.
I love coming here. The views of St. John's and the ocean, the information and gift shop inside the tower. There are beautiful hiking trails to take advantage of.

Signal Hill is a special point in St. John's, once on top of the hill, mind your hat so it doesn't blow away, and enjoy the picturesque views of the city and the ocean. There are signs posted to tell you where other places are in relation to you. While no advanced planning is needed to visit the hill, you...
Winter time makes this a very windy and cold location. But amazing views of the ocean . The building was closed "Monday-Sunday", so not open in winter I guess.

Firstly, don't miss Signal Hill if you visit St John's! It's worth your time - and the blustery experience of walking the hill top, climbing the Cabot Tower, seeing the fortifications, and walking the paths around this mouth of the harbour. The views are unparalleled. Plan a little time. See the museum and displays, enjoy the souvenir shop in the...
If you like sunrise picnics and a spot with a word class view..with some of the best hikeing ive ever seen. This is a bucket list must do

Signal Hill is iconic, with Cabot Tower dominating the landscape as it overlooks the city. It was from here that Marconi received the very first Transatlantic wireless signal in 1901. So, if you visit make sure you go inside the Tower to view the exhibits. Of course, from Signal Hill you get the best views of the oldest city in...

Not the best time to visit this spot but it had beautiful views from every place you looked. It was too dangerous to walk on the trails near the ocean as the winds were to high. About 100 km. Highest Winds in 40 years. We will definitely return on a calmer day.
Though a bit cold and windy in the winter, views are just as picturesque. Never get tired of going there. Would recommend at sunrise/sunset.

Obviously you wantto go and see the site wherethe first trans Atlantic radio communication was completed. And this also gives you a good view of the Atlantic, and if you get there in the cold months, you could see an iceberg floating at a distance.

If you've ever been to St. John's you have to go to signal hill. This is an absolute must. The views of the harbour is great and you may see a glacier if you're lucky. Go to the interpretive center and get the full experience. Your next visit should be Goerge Street for a pint and lunch. After that have...

Amazing views abound at this historical site.The trails are well-kept and some are in the process of being upgraded. The views from the hiking trails and the top of the hill are breath-taking. There are a variety of hiking trails to meet all fitness levels. The visitor center is always clean and there are park rangers to provide information. There...
Well worth the climb up the hill, amazing view if the weather is good! We had heavy fog so we could only enjoy the walk up.
Great Place to view the Atlantic Ocean, vantage point as well over looking the Habour!! Free to visit and plenty of parking!

Incredible views of St. John's and area. You absolutely must bring your camera! Spent a few hours visiting here, and it was pretty remarkable to learn so much history in such a short period of time. If the day is nice, do wear comfortable walking shoes, and plan to do some of the trail in and around the area. Great...

Went to Signal Hill in early August. The wind was so strong it felt like it would hold you up if you leaned against it.The parking lot was full and visitor's were walking around the grounds and climbing up the tower. The view overlooking the harbour takes your breath away.

The construction of Cabot Tower which was started in 1898 sits on the top of Signal Hill . It is now a Federal Heritage building .The first transatlantic wireless telegraph was sent from there in 1902.It's a very popular site for both locals & tourist. You have an amazing view overlooking the City of St.Johns with its harbour on...
View is spectacular. History of this site is worthy of a visit by those near and far. When it St. John's is a must see attraction.
A walk up to Signal Hill is part of visiting St. John's. The history of the hill, the view are all important.

The walks up are not as strenuous as they look from St Johns harbour! Vegetation is interesting and views excellent if you're lucky enough to get a clear day. Can also recommend the cafe/chocolate shop part way up. Good road access but the pathways are more interesting and its great going down!
It's a great place for tourists lots of hiking trails, and a souvenir shop inside signal hill. You can even walk to signal hill.
Lovely view looking out over the city!!! The tower itself is a beautiful old structure that looks similar to a castle..
great place to visit... beautiful view of the harbour and ships around... lots of parking. went during the night for first time,,,and it was so nice to walk the trails to get to the fort...

On Signal Hill is Cabot Tower, the castle which is where the 1st Trans- Atlantic wireless message to England.! You can tour the castle gift store, even go up to the top and look out at the colorful city of St. John's and you can see the narrows . Free. Poster boards available to read to learn history of the...
see icebergs whales fishing boats and cruise ships naviigate :The Narrows - grat view of the city of st john's snd its protected harbour and fort amherst

A view like no other. Ocean view on one side snd city,harbour view on the other. Stop in the cafe on the way up the hill for coffee snd a sweet. Walk the beautiful trail around the battery, or just enjoy the breath taking view!
A must to do will in St. John's. A million dollar view but hold your hat it's windy. Be ready to walk around and have a jacket any time of year

If the weather permits, we will always do the hike around the hill. We always try to go with two vehicles and we park one near the bottom of the hill (I think there is a museum or interpretation center there of some kind, also some public washrooms), and the other car we park at the end of the trail,...

If you are visiting St. Johns you have visit Cabot Tower at Signal Hill. The history is rich.Breathtaking view! Excellent hiking trails! Whales, icebergs and much more! You will not be disappointed and its free!
Signal Hill so pretty but you have to do a bit of walking so be prepared and it was terribly wind you and cool
Great spot overlooking St. John's. Lots of good trails to wall up from downtown or Quidi Vidi but there is a road if you prefer.
The views at the top of signal hill are absolutely spectacular! It was quite windy and cold, but absolutely worth it! Unfortunately, the tower was closed for the season, but still worth the trip!
Make sure you take a walk along the paths to see all the amazing views into downtown St. John's and out into the narrows.
Been there many times it still a wonderful site , must see if you only have a limited amount of time than this is the must see place
Spent a fabulous afternoon hiking around Signal Hill. Views are beautiful and the steps make this a much easier hike than it looks at first glance.
I have been visiting this place my whole life as I am local but still loves it. At night you can overlook the whole city lit up. Great building to visit and hike around. Also great to take pictures

As a local I go up here al the time. It's the spot for a great view of the city and the ocean (wether day or night). Though I mostly hike around on the paths during the warmer months. Just be careful of some edges (not recommended for young children and dogs). And dress for the wether, lol it is...
Although there was a heavy fog,we thoroughly enjoyed the small museum,and especially the movie presented to give the historical relevance of the hill.
We had a great visit and a chilly but wonderful stroll to Quidi Vidi afterward.The woman at the information desk gave us all the information we needed for our stay in NFLD.

Just opposite of the Ice-stadium close to the new convention centre is Express -Cafe ! The owner is friendly, polite and helpful. Kitchen is good and has a good variation of menues.On top, when little son Max is in the restaurant , it become a stage!He love to talk to the costumers and has always new ideas (Oh I...

Loved Signal Hill - the history is incredibly interesting and the views are fantastic (of the harbor & ocean). Not to mention the lovely chocolate shop with delicious hot chocolate! The weather was pretty awful the day I went. Rain and heavy wind but I still enjoyed myself!

The view was fantastic, The history was fantastic, Great gift shop. Would have been a very tough life back I the day, as the winds coming off the Atlantic were said to average 150 km. per hour with gusts up to 200 km. per hour. That would be darn cold to live with in the Maritime winter. Brrrrrrr.
I enjoyed the walking around and the excellent views. Go up the tower and go outside it is great especially on a windy day!
Signal Hill is a must see is St. John's. Both a day trip to look eastward as far as the eye can see and at night for a birds eye view of the city at night.Even in fog the view is perfect
Beautiful scenery,breath taking view of the water and the whales,also a great view of st.john at night
Went to signal hill a couple of times. Lots to see good walking trails and a great views of the water and the city of St. John's. Be sure you take some photoLove this place
My wife and I took a drive to the historic spot, granted there was some winter maintenance going on, but don't forget to stop in the Eco center and the foot of the hill for an amazing display

St John's was our first stop in Eastern Canada and the tour to Signal Hill was excellent. If you are lucky with the weather the views of the city and the ocean are spectacular and well worth the visit.
Went here with my family for a day trip the summer, really beautiful. Though make sure you wear good footwear as its a long way down :)
I visited in December, so the cafe at the top of the hill was not open. The walk was pleasant and the trails well marked.

On an exceptionally gusty and rainy day, I decided to make the hike up to signal hill. The views were well worth it, however would would recommend waiting for a day with better weather. It may seem nice within the city, but it's much more blustery up on signal hill.
I was hoping to see inside but when I reached the summit found roadworks and could not access the building so just took photos from afar.

Cabot Tower - a lone castle-like building sits on top of the highest point overlooking the ocean, St John's and the entrance to the harbour - an iconic view from both the city and the ocean. Construction of the building started in 1897 and opened in 1900.In 1901 the first transatlantic wireless transmission was received here by Marconi. Today...

I could not missed the opportunity to go to Signal Hill, it was raining but I didn't care, I was whole wet but it was worth to visit this historic place when first fortification was built in the mid of 17th century and in 1901, December 12th Guglielmo Marconi received first wireless message. Views are really amazing.

Was able to walk her from our place in the lower battery. The walk was long and great, we also were there in September and picked a million fresh wild blueberries. Oh and the views were spectacular. This is a most visit. You need to make the trip to the top.
Spectacular views of the downtown core. Great walking trails with many historical signs to point out the significance of the area.

This was home to Marconi's terminal point for the first transatlantic cable from Europe. It is a challenging stroll up to Signal Hill from downtown St. John's but the reward being the freshest of air and panoramic views over St. John's, its harbour and out to the the north Atlantic
It is the first time my sister had been to NL in 45 years and I wanted to take her to the top of Signal Hill ... unfortunately, the road up was under construction.

After the hike up Signal Hill, with an enjoyment of the views, you can take the easier sidewalk/road path down. The Johnson Geo Centre part way up is a fine stop, though we didn't have time to tour it that day.
Terrific day with sunshine and wind, hiked a trail which goes what feels like sea to sky to sea. This is slightly difficult if you are perhaps not used to elevations, wear good shoes.
My wife and I spent a couple of hours there! There was construction going on but we still got some great views of the city and the ocean!
Enjoyed a nice morning hike around Signal hill and Cabot hill. Found some the path nerving as I am afraid of heights, but was well worth seeing the harbor from this angle.
You can do hikes or just drive up for the view! Wonderful view of the harbour and also the entrance to St John's by some very amazing large ships!
Unreal views of the bay, city and ocean. Definitely worth a walk up the hill and back down along the cliffs!

We have been travelling to NF for approx 13 years now and visited Signal Hill on the first 2 or 3 trips. In October 2016 our first morning in St Johns broke with blue skies and no breeze (what?) so it was time for a revisit. The Cabot Tower at the top of Signal Hill can be seen from a...

There are two ways to get up to signal hill, the regular car route where you drive all the way up and park and go into the castle. OR if you're feeling adventurous you can make the trek up the side of the mountain. You have to park at the base and then go through a little village on the...
The grounds are currently under construction, so access is limited. However, it's worth the visit for the views and the historical interest.

A must for anyone visiting!You will get a great view of St. John's in one direction, and the beautiful sight of the Atlantic Ocean the other way. There's a few posts along the way that will give you a glimpse into some of the wonderful history this area has.

Tread carefully. Use walking sticks. Take a picnic and enjoy the best view in the city. Love the flat rock close to the water for picnic. I've done this walk many times and have been fearful of falling rock. Lovely Sunday walk and outing with friends and family!
Love it up here. The winds were insane but the views were spectacular. There is a bit of a walk up but I didn't find it too challenging. I didn't have a tour and was just fine

Headed up after lunch, cloudy day but the morning was sunny. Got to the stairs off battery road and a local said we were in for it. Mist came over Signal Hill, then the clouds let loose with a torrential shower. The path up the hill was a river flowing downhill. Still a nice walk, just a little wet!
Signal Hill holds an important place in history where Marconi accomplished the first trans-Atlantic wireless transmission.It is also important in the defence of St. John's.
I would recommend the first stop for anyone traveling to St.johns for the first time should go to signal Hill beautiful place
Very windy and rainy day so just took pictures and didn't stay long. Viewed the harbour from up there.
Near town, get there by trolley ( see town)or taxi (faster).easy visit ,walk as much as you want/ trails around. make sure you go to see the museum down lower(short walk)
Signal Hill had a lot of construction going on when we visited. There was quite a bit of walking to get to the top, but once there it was great!
Do not leave St. John's without getting to the top of this beauty, such natural beauty. Walk is beautiful but if youre not up for that grab a cab but settle on fare in advance.
Pictures and videos from this location were spectacular! You could take pictures of the entire downtown from here as well as the narrows out to the ocean.

Walk up the hill....the peak is well worth the effort. You will pass the Geo Center which is also a must-see.Breath-taking 360 degree views.at the top, with many trails to enjoy and gun enplacements to view. Interpretation/historical signage adds to your pleasure....this is absolutely one of the best parts of a visit to St John's!!!!

Signal Hill is a staple to your stay in St. John's, especially on the rare occurrence of a clear, beautiful day. I highly recommend hiking Signal Hill, even if you aren't an avid hiker - the views are breathtaking, and it feels like such a lovely escape from the city, even though you are still IN the city! A great...

Interesting to see the history and views from the hill. Shame it is currently under construction so we were unable to go to the top - weather and wind was prohibitive for walking but we did venture around the hill. Interesting to see the different settlements outlined in the harbour entrance and know that hundreds of years of city protection...

A trip to Signal Hill is truly a must do if you're visiting St. John's, and one of many reasons you should visit St. John's. For the history buff, it's a great little museum speaking to Marconi's technical achievement, as well as other aspects of the history of St. John's and Newfoundland and Labrador. If you're into natural history, there...

After a day of showers, it was nice to have the weather clear for a dramatic sunset. We arrived about a half hour before sunset, and were lucky to find a parking spot. Cabot Tower was interesting, but we didn't spend much time there. It is a very popular place and parking is limited.

You can drive or walk up the road to Signal Hill but our favorite way to get there is the harbor walk. It serpentines up the face of the hillside overlooking the harbor in a series of paths and stairways. It's a unique way to get to the top where you are rewarded with an even better view. We always...
This old building is home to a very interesting exposition, actually a museum telling you everything about the technical invention: transmitting to other continents!

This iconic landmark is clearly visible from anywhere in the entire area standing high above the landscape.We were not able to drive up to the top because of road work in the area and it was too far, too windy, too rainy and too steep to walk. I think the sign said the road would be closed until December...

We really enjoyed our visit to Signal Hill, the museum is well done and the 20min film was very interesting and entertaining, i didn't want it to end. Maybe the best part was the home made Ice cream served in the coffee shop attached.
Interesting history and great hike make this a fantastic spot. Go up on a clear night for a spectacular view of the city!

Loved reading the signs about the history of Signal Hill. The view was also spectacular! Unfortunately they had the road closed so we had to park in lower parking and hike up the hill. This was very hard on my grandfather and the staff offered no resolution to getting him up there more easily.

This is absolutely the first and foremost place to stop in St. John's.The views are spectacular of the harbour. The historical part of signal hill will be a great thing to take away and remember a lifetime.Walking up the hill is great exercise and will give you time to sit and relax when you get to the top.

As a lifetime resident of St. John's, I have made many trips to Signal Hill. In recent years, I've been going there because it's such a great form of exercise, especially walking up the hill from the bottom, either by the road itself or the various trails.I have travelled to many parts of the world and I have found...

By the third week of October the museum, cafe and washroom are closed at Signal hill. However the trails still beg to be walked and there is a washroom at the Geo center close by. Wonderful views of the harbour and interesting interpretations signs about the significance of St. John's harbour. As the top parking lot is currently closed due...
My only regret was that a storm was coming while I was there so the wind was blowing hard which limited how far up the hill I was willing to go. Stunning view of the harbour!

The history at Signal Hill is really interesting - as the spot of the first trans-Atlantic radio signal and as a battery for the defense of the entrance by sea to St. John's. But it's the views that make this place really special. You have a panoramic view of town, views over the narrow entrance to the harbor, views out...
Do yourself a favour, park on the Battery and hike of to the Hill. Splendid views and peaks into history all the way up.

Be ready to walk and uphill but it is worth it in the end. For first time visitors I would recommend seeing the 20 minute video in the small museum by the parking lot first. It will serve to put the whole visit into perspective.
This is a must do location. You have a nice view of the cabot tower and of the city of st john's. We saw it once when it was dark and once during the day. On both occasions it was nice to see!

The views from Signal Hill are amazing! The walk up may be hard for some, nice hiking trail all around, lots of signs for you to read up about the hill, some of the trail is pretty rocky, so proper footwear is advisable, get ready for a workout lots of stairs to climb but so worth it!

I've lived in Newfoundland all my life and regret to say I only walked signal hill last year. It's an amazing walk that takes in the sights of St.Johns, great activity for the summer months. Long walk but incredible but have to say I was a bit weary on times at how close to the cliff some of the trail...
Breathtaking view and such an amazing history.Peaceful beauty and beautiful sunrises and sunsets like no other place in the world.
A very interesting piece of Canadian history. The wee hike up the hill is worth it for the views alone.

This location is a must visit if you are travelling in Newfoundland. The view is spectacular! Great view of St John's harbour. The history of the site is very interesting as well and there is lots of info to read about as you walk around.
Admiring the beautiful city of St. John's and surrounding areas. The view from there is just amazing especially at night.
Whether walking or driving to the top; the view and experience of this adventure is always enjoyable. I've experienced it many times, and will do so again....and again!

The view from Signal Hill is amazing. You can see the Atlantic Ocean, St John's Harbour, and several parts of the city, depending on which side of the hill you are on. Cabot Tower has a museum and gift shop. Depending on the time of year, my visit may include a hike along the hill, watching the Tattoo or marveling...
The only way to visit Signal Hill is to climb the trial that goes along the coast and has ALOT of stairs! Worth the hike!

Because the top parking lot was under construction at Signal Hall, we had to walk up the hill from the information centre in an approximately 40 know (80 kph) wind in a misty rain. But when we got up there, the view was great, the history detailed very well its' use over the years, and the staff were very accommodating....

We took the east harbour coastal trail that offered beautiful sea views. A good deal of climbing but no serious terrain, very enjoyable and great views back to town from the top. Nice little museum as well at the top.

The view from Signal Hill is just beautiful. The road up to the tower is closed until December, so you will have to park at the museum and hike up (it's steep but worth it). Very interesting history surrounds the area!

Not sure what I expected when we drove up to Signal Hill but what I found was far better than I expected. There is a nice little info center that give you an overview, and around it are some nice trails. Hike to the top (or drive) and you find yourself up at the site of the old military fortivications...
Started at the chocolate shop....then went for a hike. Amazing views, especially on a sunny day. Information centre was helpful.
If you are in the area, this is place you must see. The views are spectacular. There is also a HamRadio station that is fascinating.
Signal hill has so much history around the area it is well worth the winding ride to the top. To see how much was accomplished just to build it.

If you would like to park and take in the view that in itself will make you appreciate this location. If you are sightseeing the visit could be completed in 15 mins, hiking would take 1-2 hours depending on the trail you select. If you like to hike then this is a great spot for that as well, it's not...
The walk up the hill is long but well worth every step and when you reach the top the view of the city is amazing! A must see when in St. John's

Loved doing the north loop that starts at the bottom and goes around the rocks of the harbor. It is a tough climb . Some places there is stairs with handrails and steep terrain. The end is a very steep slope to signal hill. The views along this hike are spectacular!! Take water, good shoes, and energy and pics!! Set...

The main road going up to the top was under construction so we had to walk up and down. If the weather would have been bad, it would have been horrible to do. Also if mobility is an issue, this wouldn't have been a good one either.But the view from the top was amazing. There is so much history...
we walked the trail from the top back down into st johns, the walkway was well maintained, plenty of places to stop and admire the views, a must if you are visiting this area

Visiting in October yielded public works projects at the top. We were forced to walk up from the visitors centre with yielded plenty of exercise but i am curious if they permitted handicap vehicular access to the top.
Make sure you walk up or drive to Signal hill, it offers great views of the city and harbor. A great place to see the sunset.

You can drive to the lower parking lot, and from there you have to hike up the hill. The hike is somewhat steep but worth it to see the view of the harbor and city. It was cloudy and very windy when we were there, so the views were probably not as nice as when the weather is better. Still...

Bring a wind breaker when visiting signal hill. You can park steps away if you'd like or hike up to signal hill for a workout. There is a visitor's center several feet away (middle of the hill) where you can use the restroom and gather information.The scenery is simply stunning. We hiked to Quidi Vidi from here.
We're here to complete our trans Canada crazy journey, by the time we're here, the signal hill was closed some area. I didn't have a good look for this attraction. Sorry

With the upper parking lot closed for renovation, getting to the hill top is a bit of a climb but definitely worth it. The view of the harbour is great and it's quickly obvious that an enemy trying to get through the entrance would have a hard time. The view back over the city is wonderful. Seeing The Rooms from...

This is a must see sight. You get some good exercise on the way up. Then you can have a good look at the harbour and The Cabot Tower. Be careful though, it can be very windy. My sister and I had to hang onto each other to keep from being blown over.
Make sure you get a chance to make it up to Signal Hill. Gives a great view of the harbor, the narrows and it opening up into the Atlantic Ocean.

A must visit while in St John's. Learn the history and enjoy the walking trails. Stay for the firing of the noon day gun, only one other city in Canada fires a gun/cannon at noon. Do you know where that is? You can also be the lucky one to fire the gun. It is a great experience! See the city...

If you don't have time to do anything else, make time to stroll up to the Cabot Tower on the summit of Signal Hill. the view is terrific and if you have previously viewed the 15 minute film at the Interpretation Centre, you can almost feel what the early soldiers and settlers went through some centuries ago. Great for the...
not to be missed. The hike around the point was fantastic with gorgeous view of St John's. Lots of history. One of St John's treasures
Meant to walk up to Signal Hill but didn't, the weather was not very good. So we didn't. Next time we will

We went up on a very sunny day. Stunning views and very windy. There is construction up at the top which is really no bother at all other than for pictures. If you have mobility issues you can't drive up due to road construction but still worth the views from the lower parking lot

Again, our tour group wasn't advised that the display wasn't open. The road to the top of Signal Hill was closed so our van couldn't go to the top. This was extremely disappointing for those who couldn't do the long, steep walk.View was lovely, and the history is amazing, but we would have liked to see the display and...
A must see if you are in St. John's. It's windy up there. Stop at the Johnson Geo Centre on the way up.

So loved Signal Hill ! Stunning views and loads of history....combine that with beautiful walking and this is a perfect place to vist. It's well worth the very short drive up from St John,s ...on the same road oa the Geo Centre and Chocolate Cafe/tourist Centre. Also has a small gift shop. I definitely recommend visiting here...choose a good day...
This is the spot for great pics of the habour entrance and St John's proper but only good on sunny days. Make sure you take a warm coat as the wind is usually up and it can be chilly.

We walked from town up to signal hill it took about 30mins but the walk down the coastal path was beautiful. ...all in all it took about 2 hours with time to visit the small museum at the top. Well worth doing

This hill is quite close to St. John's. Normally there are two parking lots, one being part way up and the other at the top, but the road to the top lot was closed for construction when we were there, so we hiked up. There are some fortifications overlooking the St. John's Narrows, which offer a lovely view. The tower...

We walked up the coastal path to access Signal hill and Cabot Tower, the walk added to the experience and gave us a good overview of St John during our brief visit. After visiting Cabot Tower we then walked over to Quidi Vidi and back along the lake. The whole experience took about three hours which also gave us time...
Lots of great hikes. Gorgeous view from the top. Beautiful demonstration of Marconi's first wireless transmission.

You can do this the easy way by driving to the top, moderate by driving and parking half-way up, or walk from Water Street. The views of the harbour are superb and we were told that in Jun and Jul you often see icebergs at sea. We also went back up in the evening(drove up that time) to take some...

What a great place to see both the city, and the ocean. A nice walk up the hill (the upper parking lot is closed, so if you have mobility issues it would be tricky. We liked watching the movie about the history of the hill, which plays in the visitor centre. It was free for us (parks Canada discovery pass),...
Great place to visit with a lot of history. Highly recommended. Beautiful views. The parking lot at the top of the hill was closed so you had to walk to the top, but the view was worth it.

I came here on my first day in St. John's, and every day after that! I loved it here. There are loads of views to be taken in and the different trails take you to see the area from another angle. You have a great view of downtown St. John's, Fort Amherst and the Atlantic.
Unique location and history. Highly recommended, especially with kids. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes for the hike. Take it all in!
A definite must see. Currently the road up to the Citadel is under construction and is blocked off at the Interpretation Center. You can still walk to it.

Great way to orient in St. John's ... The history, harbour and downtown all in a single visit. Well spaced so we aren't all on top of each other. Late September we lucked on a clear-ish day and enjoyed hiking the north trail (our kids 4 and 6 handled it fine). Definitely recommend for any trip to Nfld.
I enjoyed wandering around reading and thinking about history and walking as much as we wanted. The price was right.. Free...

Even though the adjacent parking lot was under construction, it was still well worth the hike up the hill just for the view alone. Add in the incredibly important role the site played in the history of modern communication and this attraction is not to be missed.

Signal Hill is very popular with the locals and it is easy to see why ! It offers the best views over the port and the city , it has great hiking trails , museums and picnic places and there ample is space for everyone ! No wonder it is the number 1 activity in this beautiful city !

This was the very first stop of our 5 day getaway to St. John's Newfoundland. We came back twice more - once at 8pm to watch the cruise ship Aida navigate The Narrows below. Such a treat! we were waving them off with a host of locals who came wrapped in blankets to do the same. Can't wait to return...

We drove up the hill by mistakenly taking the wrong turn. We would have gone anyway but just not then. It's any easy drive but a lot of people walk up either the sidewalk or a path on the other side. about half way up is an interpretive centre with washrooms and displays.At the top is the tower that...

If you are in St. John's, you have to visit Signal Hill. The historica significance of the site as well as the amazing views from the hill. Unless, you are a hardy hiker, I suggest going up the hill by vehicle. If you don't have a vehicle, the trolley makes a run up there. It comes through once an hour...

Be warned--the parking lot at the top of Signal Hill is closed, we were told it would be closed til December. This means you have to park at the visitors center, and then walk up a pretty steep hill to get to the top.That being said, the view was worth it. You get a wonderful view of St. John's...

When we visited the road up to Signal Hill was closed for repairs and the hike to the top was very difficult for some. The view at the top is spectacular! A must see but they should have had some form of transportation to the top for individuals who can't make the hike.

We stumbled up here by accident as we were just driving through the city without our tour book. Wow what a fantastic view of the city and the ocean. We highly recommend making your way up this very steep incline walking or in a car. If walking warning it is very steep and we saw people struggling to make it...

A 10 minute drive from downtown. You can walk around outside on numerous trails that lead down to the water. The views are amazing!!! The building has a small exhibit and gift shop and you can get out on the roof. The trail down to the point takes 45 minutes return with a kid (there are +150 steps coming back...
The signature tourist sight in St. John's. Spectacular views over the city and sea. And hardly crowded even in peak season.

Signal Hill has it all: great views of the city and ocean, a rich history with various educational posts to explain it, and a place for strenuous exercise. I come to St. John's often for business, and on each occasion, I take the opportunity to jog up signal hill. It is always the highlight of my trip. I also recommend...
View was awesome but we're hoping to see some iceberg or whale. Unfortunately we're unlucky. Need to try the hiking trail, one of the best in the world
Amazing views for as far as the eye can see. And if your lucky you will get to meet chief the newfoundland dog!!
My wife and I visited Signal Hill and were very impressed with the site. The film at the Welcome center is a must-see. Very informative and well done.

Loved walking around the Hill and photographing the 360' views. It is amazing and a must see! I did not realize that St. John's was such a beautiful city. The walking trails are such a bonus to this beautiful attraction and I enjoyed the history, the flowers, the exercise and meeting the locals along the way.

The view from Signal Hill offers a panoramic view of the narrows, St. John's Harbour and the city itself. It delights newcomers and locals alike. While sunny weather will offer perfect visibility, Signal Hill is a fabulous place to watch sea fog roll in. The fog hits the onshore cliffs and then drools through the narrows of the harbour and...

What a great place to enjoy a piece of Canadian history and a great view of St John's as well as the Atlantic Ocean! The gift shop was pricey, but it's not really necessary to buy anything. You can just go there for the experience and great photos!
Signal hill and Cabot tower are definitely a must see. The history surrounding them is awesome. The views from the hill and tower were spectacular . The fact that it is a free attraction is a bonus.

This is one of those most easterly points in the province. It is a breath-taking view when you get to the top! You are able to hike/bike/picnic, anything you want! And there is a visitor's center as well where you can buy NL chocolate and other treats. A must see if you are visiting Newfoundland!

This is the one venue not to be missed in St John's. The veiw alone is worth the trip up to the top. A lot of history here, for me a very personal spot in my own family history. Don't miss this place, when you are here.

An absolute must to see while in St. John's. The views are stunning and the trails around the site Re a must. You can see both the Atlantic and the city of St. John's from the site. Dress in layers as the winds can be surprising.
The view is amazing. be prepared for wind. You can drive up so far for people who can not "make the climb.

We walked from our rental home on Colonial and it was quite an uphill hike so if you are not in great shape suggest you drive your car up to top? The views are wonderful and both our teens enjoyed it as well.
Beautiful place for wedding pictures. Beautiful view. Must see when you visit St.Johns. Truly love Signal Hill !!!!!!
Beautiful hiking trail and tower at the top. This was one of my favorite sites in St John's. Be prepared, can get cold when walking next to the water. Highly recommended. Love it!
Fantastic views and part of Canada's history. We were lucky to arrive just before the noon gun was fired. You can see the tip of Cape Spear on a clear day!

I tend to take for granted the views in Newfoundland having lived here my entire life but I must admit, signal hill at night time always makes me smile.Daytime is beautiful as well, if it's foggy the view isn't what it should be.

We parked at the Geo Centre and walked down the hill a we bit and joined the trail to hike to the top. WOW! The hike was a good walk, and those with height issues should just drive to the top. Stopped several times for photo ops and enjoyed the views. Should take you 40-50 mins.

Unless you're a sucker for punishment, drive to one of the parking lots and take the paths from there. Have walked these paths several times. Once saw bald eagle chicks/fledglings (2014). Many, many steps and some paths have steep terrain. If you're lucky you may see whales or icebergs if at the right time of year. Good views of the...
The freshest of air, spectacular scenery and a fun small city with European roots and culture! The people are relaxed and fun and restaurants are amazingly good!
This place is absolutely beautiful night and day! The view of the city is incredible! And the trails around Signal Hill are great.
Wow. To me one of the most beautiful sites in Canada. Look at the ocean, the harbour. Qidi Vidi harbour. Etc. Historic tower ( Cabot Tower)
A must go in St. John's. Great views and hiking. Easy to get to by car or bus--if you're thinking about walking to it from downtown, prepare for a long trek up some fairly steep going!

We walked with our 8 and 6 yr Olds from the lake to lookout trail at Forest Rd all he way up to Signal Hill and Cabot tower. If you're relatively fit walking the whole way makes a nice morning and there's lots to see on the way. We were really fortunate to arrive just in time for the 12pm...
must see. slow on the steep hills and turns. magnificent view of city of st. john's. great trails for hikers as well.

Canadian Historical site. Lovely views of the city. Lots of walking trails. The view of St. Johns at night is amazing. Grab a coffee and just go look at the city at night with some good company. Definitely worth a visit.

We arrived at Signal Hill in time for the firing of the Noonday Gun (which you can sign up to fire for $49 through the visitor center). Firing the cannon was fun (although they could stand to fix up the provided costume a bit).The North Head Trail, which winds around the hill, was absolutely beautiful and a good hike....
Given my own technical background combined with an interest in both Canadian history and telecommunications, the visit to Signal Hill was fantastic. Highly recommend the visit.

We did the walk from the visitor centre to the top which is a nice easy hop and allows you to visit the battery on the way. You can also just drive to the top, or walk from the town itself. The hike from the town looked a little too much cliff edges for me. Great views and the firing...
Something you must see outstanding views! Many trails to explore some difficult and scary if you don't like heights but everyone can enjoy the views! Highly recommend.

Lovely historical site, with great views. The hike you can do (up or down) takes about 40 minutes and was under a bit of construction when we were there. Locals jog/run this, but I recommend stretching beforehand if you're not super fit. Wear good shoes!

We were constantly advised by friends and kind taxi drivers not to miss seeing the views from 'Signal Hill' -- they were so right! It was so breath-taking: the expansive gorgeous sea, lighthouse and sea-cliffs on one side and an entire birds-eye view of the lovely city of St. John's on the other -- so beautiful! Loved it!
Interesting history. A bit of a schlep uphill so not great for people with mobility issues. Nice vistas. Most easterly part of NL. Good for war buffs.

Signal Hill is very interesting and getting to know about Marconi and his invention as well as its history as a military installation and hospital was great. But definitely, the selling point is the gorgeous all around view. Came here twice (including at sunrise). Spectacular.
You see all of St John's and the ocean, we saw icebergs, learned about Marconi, which made our later visit to the transatlantic cable station in Heart's Content more interesting
It is all about the views, both inland, the bay, and ocean - and they are impressive. In our case, we actually preferred Cape Spear.

We spent maybe 30 minutes here. You can park up the very top, adjacent to the tower.There's a boardwalk all the way around the tower which gives a great panoramic view of St John's and the ocean.The tower itself had a small museum inside on the invention of wireless communication.There appeared to also be hiking trails down...

Nice place to see the coast and St. John's in one view. Interesting history. Many trails to hike of that is something you are into. Only losses a star as the views are not as spectacular as other places around St. John's.

The views are exceptional and the exhibit on Marconi is very interesting. Don't miss it. Drive if you need to, but I highly recommend walking the coastal trail up there. Very doable and no worries with traffic on the streets leading up to it. (Guide books were unclear about walkability).

Lovely views into the Harbour of St.John's. Worth the time to walk about and visit if you have the chance while your in St.John's. While here you can see the harbour from signal hill and out to sea. Alot of history dates way back to when the french and british where fighting for occupancy over the new world.

Good info Center, helpful and resourceful, that's about it.Lots of hiking trails and locals come up to see the city. But essentially an 'inward' signal hill, which informed city folk if there were enemy vessels, like French, Portuguese or Dutch, attacking the harbour in 1600s.Cabot tower, built in 1900s is essentially the face of signal hill.

The views were outstanding! The whole city is laid out in front and a great photo-op. We are able to go up to the top and look around from there. Info plaques were helpful and kiosk staff were able to answer questions as well. We took in the scenery and enjoyed the historical aspect as well.

Great history. Make sure you have good shoes if you decide to hike down to the bottom. Lots of stairs and at some point close to the edge of the cliff. You need to be steady on your feet. It was well worth the hike the views are amazing
Rode to the top and walked down to the visitor centre. Good gift centre and trails all over to get back down good view of the city and the harbour entrance. Fishing vessel going out.

If you or someone you know is planning a visit to St. John's, then plan an excursion up Signal Hill...to the most magnificient view of the oldest city in North America, and of course, the view of the Atlantic for as far as the eye can see. Also, if it's clear, see Cape spear in the distance...a must see for...

There is a lot of history at Signal Hill which was used for many purposes over the years. There is a little museum to learn about its past. However, I think the best part of Signal Hill was the view of the city of St. John's and the great trails around the hill.

The scenery is simply gorgeous. The workout, not so much. I had cheated and used the Google Street View to check this place out before our trip...so I knew that at one point walking the trails around Signal Hill there was a series of stairs built into the hill (I'd estimate about...oh, a thousand or so), that went up at...

My family visited for an afternoon and enjoyed the awesome views of the harbour and city of St John's. A must visit for those (like me) who appreciate history including the early days of Marconi's wireless communications. We also caught the Signal Hill Tattoo which was a very scaled-down military-themed parade at additional cost: nothing very special but a nice...

This was one of my first stops while traveling across NL on my motorcycle. I must say a trip to St. John's would not be complete without visiting this amazing spot! Lots of history and incredible views of the entire city!

Perhaps the number one place to visit if you are visiting St.Johns. Though close to downtown and hotel do not attempt to walk up to Signal Hill unless you have a few hours. Once on the hill be sure to take in the views and the great sign that points to many other capital cities indicating their distances from Signal...

What a great way to start day one in St. John's. A great view of the city and ocean with some nice walking trails around the grounds. Interesting piece of Newfoundland and telegraph history well documented. Enough information and engaging enough for the kids. Head up the hill and take it in.
Free parking and million dollar views from this iconic Canadian land mark make it a must see when visiting St Johns.

Since it was my first time to St. John's, I had to see Signal Hill. We hiked up the hill, taking in incredible views of the harbour and narrows, along with amazing views of the landscape and ocean. We were lucky enough to see 4 whales in the water as well! A fantastic hike that is a must.
Good trails, bike inclusive, stunning views and a bit of history. I recommend to anyone passing by St Johns !!!!!!

From here you see the whole city, the most easterly point on the continent and Ocean towards Europe. I've seen foxes, whales, birds of all types and that's not even touching the geography. A must see.
on the way to the top stop along the way and just take in the many views you have. windy so dress for IT.bring camera if you are not in shape take car to top or bus it .
Drive to the top, and wait for a parking spot. They are constantly available.The view is amazing.Walk inside and climb to the top. Interesting live demo of telegraph.The best thing, its all free!

With several trails to chose from the signal hill hiking trails offer up plenty of views and charm. The main hike from the tower to the battery is approx 3 km in length and would roughly take 1 hr to do. highly recommend.
Wow! Wonderful! So great to see this part of our country. Loved the entire area and the gift shop. Great work Newfoundland!

We took the easy walk from the visitor center parking lot up to Cabot Tower on Signal Hill. It was a very windy day. Happened to be there after 11am and were there for the noon firing of the cannon from the Tower - very cool! Really fascinating spot of history for St. John's, well told through signage on top...

This is worth the short drive out of St Johns. It is easily accessible, and you get great views from the top of the hill. The tower was built around 1900, and is now a museum Marconi made his first wireless transmission from here in 1901. There are also interpretation boards at the top.
Iconic, historic, and breathtaking.For the brave of heart, take the narrow cliffside hike to the summit, high above St. John's Harbour.

The views really are spectacular. You can either drive all the way to the top, walk a short trail from a mid-point or take the longer trail which is a more aggressive walk (lots of stairs), which is worth the effort and rewards you with spectacular vistas around every corner.
Offers breathtaking views of the city of St John's and the ocean. Good place to hang out . Take a short hike and get a sense of history of the fort on signal hill
What a view! Take a climb up to the top of the tower for a view over St. Johns. There"s a nice walking trail along the rock cliffs for those who want a beautiful short hike.
Spectacular views all around. Pics later.First wireless transmission across the atlantic.Protected port of St John's. Tremendous walking trails of all exertion levels.Nice little gift store.
Go there for the history and a great view of the harbour - pretty at night since you can see everything lit up.
A great spot to head up to see the view of St. John's harbour, the city and Cape Spear in the foreground. Beautiful spot to see the views of the area. Enjoy!

It is always amazing to see nature at it's best and to be able to stand at Signal Hill and look out across the narrows and to see the majesty of the harbor, it was an incredible day that provided such a wonderful view.
best place to orient yourself. Se all the seasons from this vantage point. Whales Icebergs, and wild Atlantic.
We hiked up to signal hill and took the battery trail coming down. It was very lovely! The view of the city and the ocean is spectacular! Bring warm clothes cause it is always windy there
Walking trails...hiking wonderfulMore signs for direction of trails and maps but otherwise greatTattoo and reenactment done very well

Stopped by here twice because we didn't realize how many trails there were. This is a great stop for sightseeing. Excellent views of St. Johns and the ocean, a bit of history and nice trails.I would definately recommend bringing some good walking shoes or hiking shoes as the trails are quite rocky. There are a lot of stairs but...
First day in St.John's. Opportunity to drive to higher ground and look down on the water as well as the city.

Signal Hill is a must for any visitor to St. John's. For the less adventurous a drive up for a look at the views over the city and ocean are breathtaking. For those looking for a more strenuous activity the hike through the Battery and up the hill is most recommended. (You can also walk up the road to the...

If you're in St John's and into sightseeing, this is a place that needs to be on your list. It was built high on the hill and has a great view all around. There really isn't much here besides the view and a gift shop, but for a nice relaxing day with a cool walk, this is something to see.

Great place to see the city lights at night;I love to hike during the day and eat the blueberries along the way;my American bf enjoyed it too;he was amazed by the trails and the walkways on the cliffs;the incline was great for our quads and gluteus ;-)
One of the most beautiful hikes in St. John's. Going up is a better exercise. Only takes about 45mins to 1 hr with enough time to take pics.

Bring your running (most comfortable walking) shoes. The terrain is not for the faint of heart.The views were breathtaking, walking from the Cabot Tower around the point into town was well worth the extra distance.Lots of people, all of whom were very friendly.Had the pleasure of hearing live flutes and drums being played at the bottom of...

always a plus to see whales in the ocean swimming by - beautiful views from the buildings - ocean and inland - great photo ops here - and it was free - last time we went you had to walk most of the way up the hill - now you can drive :)

One of the must-see attractions in St. John's. Very scenic and historical. Accessible from the city downtown by foot or car. Visit in the morning for clear and picture-worthy pictures of the downtown and harbor.

Lots of different waking/hiking opportunities. Remember to bring your water bottle and power bars. Views stunning. . Quaint gift shop lots of variety. Chocolate Cafe at info center was VERY expensive.
Visited on a beautiful sunny day and the view over St John's was just stunning. Information centre with displays. Toilet at the centre.

Incredible view of both the coastline and the city of St John's. Can be very windy at times, so come prepared. We went 3 times during our 1-week stay...just couldn't help going back for another look. Must go at night time as well if possible. Visitor centre is excellent - great Newfoundland Chocolate and ice cream and can watch the...

I walked up Signal Hill twice. The first time, I went up the road to the Visitors' Center and then did the rest of the climb on the footpaths. Then I walked down on the East Coat Trail. I wish I'd thought to wear a hat and bring water (it was sunny and warm), but the beauty of the views...
I've visited this site numerous times. It's simply gorgeous. The views and trails are great. The renovations are complete.
This is a must see attraction if you are in St. John's but it is very busy in the summer. Not much parking up top so park below and enjoy the hike to the top.

When in St John's we always take time out to visit Signal Hill and look out for the whales.we were not disappointed saw the whales in the distance.a short walk away from the car park leaves the crowds of people behind.
WE drove to the hillthere was plenty of parking.The view of the ocean and the harbour are terrific. Dependind on the day, it can be very windy and cold

I was in town with family and did not anticipate visiting the site but as we were parked in a lot my 5 year old son spotted the "castle" on the horizon and so I told him the basics of what it was and off we went. He enjoyed the "castle", looking out at the city and how high up...

While most drive to the parking lot and walk up you can reach the summit from Quidi Vidi and also from the Battery. The Battery hike is my favorite as it scales the mountainside along the harbour. All are worth doing and dont miss out on the walk up the look out. It is spectacular.
This is the No 1 stop for anyone visiting the city. Breathtaking views over the city and the ocean. Whale watching.
We climbed and endured Signal Hill on foot and were almost blown off the peak with gusts of 140km winds. Enjoyed the views though.

Hiked from downtown which is good for a challenge 1.5 miles to top and 2.5 miles via the battery. Very pretty. Good views. Interesting information on the site at the top. It would be a challenging hike for those not in shape.
I think that everyone should make the effort, the views are unreal. I cant recommend a trip to signal hill enough!

If in St. Johns you do want to go to Signal Hill, if for no other reason than its historical significance. A visitors center is located at the top with a nice display on the second floor providing the full story of Signal Hills role in Marconis development of trans-Atlantic wireless communications. A nice gift shop is located on the...
Signal Hill is a great place to visit and the views are great.Don't go to St. Johns Newfoundland and not visit !!
Fun to visit and the area is beautiful. Once you figure out the configuration of the streets, travel is easy.

We hiked down to the point in fierce winds. It was a balmy warm summer day. I loved it. At the top of signal hill there's a small muse and gift store. Fabulous views of St John's. A must see if you're visiting.
No trip to St. John's is complete without a stop on signal hill. Be sure to take in the views and climb the to the top. The trail down and around to the Battery is worth all the steps as well.
This is a great way to see the city of St. John's from all sides.Sun shinning but wind would blow you away.

We loved our visit to Signal Hill. The views all around are astonishing. We also climbed the Cabot tower for more and more great vistas. Found the Marconi exhibit there super interesting. This is only for people who like to go into more detail and are interested in science and inventions..not for the quick tourist look.

We were so happy the fog cleared for us this visit! Hiking trails are gorgeous, and the view from the top of Signal Hill is breathtaking. We also love reading the plaques and learning the history of the hill. We were able to catch the noonday gun firing, which is a very cool experience, too. It's a must-see spot for...
Take the $5 trolley up the hill, spend a little time here, then walk around the trails or head back down the hill to the Johnson GEO Center.

Heading up to signal hill for a visit, take my advice and turn it into a small hike. Now we walked up from the harbour starting at the Terry Fox monument. That's a pretty solid hike and you don't start to see some nice areas until you get to the Geo Centre. My advice, park there, go to the small...

Feel like a little or long hike? Want to check out the spot where Marconi sent his first wireless message to ships at sea? Stand on a windy hill overlooking St. John's? Do all of these at Signal Hill, on the cliffs at the edge of the city. You might get lucky and spot a whale, see a cargo ship...
A must see for history buffs or science enthusiasts. Go up the narrow stairs in the tower to get the view of the city.
Highly recommended that as soon as you land in SJ, before you go anywhere else, go up her and get your bearings!
Geo Centre on way to Hill fabulous and perfect for kidsSignal Hill...lots of history, knowledgable young people on staff.Well worth the walk or trolley ride

We enjoyed our visit. No trip to St. John's should miss Signal Hill. We were interested in the cannons, less so in Marconi. I think, personally, that the significance of the place is a bit unclear, since it has been used for such a variety of reasons and is therefore dilute. The message needs to be sharpened up.

The view itself is enough to draw visitors, but there is more to keep you. Cabot Tower, which is now a gift/information centre has some cute local trinkets and souvenirs. There are cool old canons, informative signage, and an abundance of trails. I must admit, the cliffs here freak me out a bit, but there are safe (family friendly) trails,...

Great historical site representing the first wireless communication by Marconi. It offers beautiful views of the city and the ocean. On their first day in St. John's I visited Signal Hill with friends who had never been to Newfoundland. The views offered from this location did not disappoint.I didn't have the opportunity to walk up to Signal Hill from...

Awesome views of Saint John's and the harbor. It is amazing that huge ships can fit through the narrows. Whales are often visible swimming at sea.Visitor center shows a short film that is quite good. Learned a lot about the history and significance of this spot. Shouldn't be missed!

Great places to take photos of both Cabot Tower, and of St. Johns itself. Cabot Tower is filled with all kinds of interesting material about the local military history and significance in Trans-Atlantic communication.

We parked at the GEO centre and walked up to Signal Hill. There were some steep hills to climb but we were rewarded with beautiful views of St John's harbour, the narrows and the ocean. Interesting info signs along the way with some history and neat facts. I would recommend walking up to the Tower first, and then crossing the...

We just loved it here and I took the best pictures around. We were lucky to get the fog entering the harbour but without clouding the view too much. The tour of the castle was brilliant learning how the first wireless communication happened a century ago. A must for the whole family.
Beautiful views, informative grounds, and scenic walks available. Do go early. Parking lot filled by late morning. Firing of noon hour gun was brief but informative, unique.

My wife and children walked the route up the hill to signal hill. It was challenging but we'll worth the sweat. Lots of places to stop and enjoy the views. Totally worth it. If you want to drive you can.
This was a great stop, highly recommended. Informative and wonderful views. Good for all ages. Accessible.
Do the hike...enjoy the view! Allow time to absorb the history and the incredible scenery around you.
Climb the Cabot Tower, the best view in St John's. Free admission. We saw an iceberg July 8! Great exercise if you start at the bottom of the hill or hike the trails.

We walked up to the Signal Hill from downtown St. John, lingered a bit around the top and toward Quidi Vidi, and then hiked down and along the entrance to the bay. Absolutely fantastic vistas and an excellent view of Fort Amherst lighthouse. A very much recommended and not so difficult hike on well maintained trails. My wife has MS,...
Great walking trails (wear appropriate footwear); views of the ocean and city are amazing (you may even get to see icebergs and whales); a must for everyone.
Great sights and history!!! A must to see - really breathtaking!! Bring a camera and use the panoramic option! Also a wonderful view of St John's harbour.
You really should go see this, also visit the Geocentre! We saw a whale just off the coast.It's a great hike if you are able but there is also a trolley bus that is a hop on hop off for $5.

We spent a couple of hours here this morning, we firstly went into the visitors centre which was interesting but we missed the film by seconds then the second one was in French so didn't get to see it at all. The walk up to Signal Hill is very steep so it is worth taking the car up there if...

Interesting history, great views and fun to see the noon day gun fired at noon (block your ears!) We also watched the military tattoo, performed several times a week weather permitting. The fog comes and goes within minutes.

Even if you can't hike up, Signal Hill is a must do, primarily for the beautiful views of the Atlantic, harbour and city. Cabot Tower is worth a visit for the structure itself, the Marconi exhibit and a pretty impressive gift shop, but don't plan on spending much time there. The true benefit comes from either hiking up through the...
Great place to see and photograph the city if there is no fog. A lot of uneven walking. Gun shooting of at noon is something to see.
Due to fog, it took a couple of days to actually see anything. When the fog cleared, the view was amazing. Great place for photos of the entire area.
Go early or later afternoon to avoid the bus tours. A very popular attraction that is a genuine must see in St. John's!

A must see for any visitor of St. John's, Signal Hill is a great place for hiking and taking in breathtaking views in all directions. In addition, Signal Hill is itself a historic site, including the castle keep-like Cabot Tower, a reminder of the Hill's past as a military outpost, and the place where Marconi received the first transatlantic wireless...

The views from Signal Hill are amazing. Alantic ocean on one side and the St.Johns harbour on the other. You can see so much. All the different colour buildings and homes in St.Johns. Free parking but not much parking right up by Signal Hill. Lots of walking trails. Great spot for the family to spend the afternoon.

Wonderful walks and views from Signal Hill - beware of the wind near the Cabot Tower (my glasses blew off and broke!) Great gift shop in the Cabot Tower for presents from Newfoundland. Nearby is the Johnson Geo Centre. In the Summer the "Shakespeare by the Sea" theatre group have up to 2 open air performances of a Shakespeare play...
Enjoyed the breathtaking views, hiking around the site, and history surrounding this place. Nice gift shop.
An historic site with spectacular views which is the case for just about anywhere you go in Newfoundland.
If you are going to St Johns as tourist then this is one of the must-see attractions. Only go on a good weather day. Great views and the tower itself is well worth the visit.
Breathtaking views and great historical significance are the themes of SIgnal Hill. A must see and a great introduction to this wonderful city. Beware of fog!

We walked up to Signal Hill and the Cabot Tower from downtown St. John's today. Even dawdling and stopping for pictures it took only about 1.5 hours, and the views along the way were glorious, looking back on the city as well as out past the headlands to the Atlantic Ocean. The trails are well-trod and signposts add context. The...
We were at Signal Hill in July - extremely windy the day we were there, but the views of St. John's harbour were beautiful and the history of the site was very interesting.
Enjoyed the drive up the hill and the reenactment cannon firing. Views of the St. John's harbor are spectacular.

The view is beautiful whether you're looking at the sea or facing the city. The brisk wind was exhilarating as we explored rocky trails bordered with abundant wild flowers. We couldn't stop snapping pics. Oh and you have to see the vista of St. John's from Signal Hill at night, its a blanket of lights, breathtaking.
Nice view of the surrounding area including the harbor, ocean, and city. It is free and has many walking paths. The coffee shop is open late most days and has delicious chocolate desserts.

You need to visit Signal Hill twice - once during the day and then at nighttime. The views are spectacular as is its history. We were fortunate to see a tanker coming in at night and the night view of the city is great!

There is an amazing view of St. John's from Signal Hill. We visiting on our last day in St. John's and it was incredible to see the city we had enjoyed for a few days from above. Another incredible view was watching whales as we sat on the hill. On our way back to our car we found a one...
You can drive to top -- lots of parking! Gorgeous view of ocean, city and harbour! Lots of hiking trails to other view points!
Was a great hike up the hill. My boys 5-8 handled it well and loved playing on the cannons. Amazing sites to see from the top and we were even able to enjoy a whale out in the bay.

This historical site is a must see while in St.John's and the view is picture perfect. On the subject of trails, there are really nice ones around the hill. With planning, water bottles and time, it would have been great.Many people walk their way up, even from town, and we intended to drive to the lower level parking lot...

Took the trail starting on battle road up the stairs and path! Such a lovely day for it and even spotted some whales! Took the trail the opposite way down toward quidi vidi and did a brewery tour after! Great afternoon!
A must-do in St. John's, even if just for the view. Beautiful scenery. We watched some of the tattoo, then walked up to Cabot Tower, and back down the trail by the cannons. Those were a kid favorite!

I recently visited Signal Hill with my family and for the first time, decided to take a walk around the perimeter and enjoy the full Signal Hill experience. Walked to Signal Hill from Water Street, and then took the trail from there to Quidi Vidi. There are several look outs which provide very nice views of the Harbour and the sea. Beautiful view awesome historic location, many travelers visiting signal hill. Very picturesque location.

We were lucky with the weather for our visit to Signal Hill but what views. The information plaques situated all round the signal station were informative and well laid out. The display about Marconi in the Cabot Tower was well planned and thorough. Make sure you include this in your visit to St John's

Doing this hike made my trip to St Johns. If you are feeling slightly less adventurous or are worried about the uneven ground you can walk up the road or even take the bus!The views that you are rewarded with at the top are beyond description.Would do this again in a heartbeat.

This is a must see on your trip to St.John's. We got there after the museum was closed but it was still worth the trip. Spectacular views of St Johns, the harbour, and the narrows leading to the Atlantic.Great exhibits around the building. Fantastic walking trails.

We had a great time climbing signal hill. The views were completely breath-taking. As we sat on the grass watching the ocean, we even saw an ice-berg float by. We spent hours hiking here and taking beautiful pictures. The views were amazing and it was one of the focal points of our trip.

Bundle up if you head up to Signal Hill. It's exposed and windy all the time which can be quite cold outside of the sunniest, summer days. It's covered in walking trails and Cabot Tower sits pretty, overlooking the city. The views are fantastic, especially looking out at the lights overnight.

You have to go to Signal Hill if you're in St. John's. There are many good hiking trails, the noon gun is fun to see/hear and the history of the location is fascinating. There are also great views of the city/harbour.

The view of and from the hill is a must but the building is small and inside rather unimpressive. Other historic sights of less importance have been developed more. Great walk from town centre to hill of history and great views.On a good day it would be a good picnic spot.

If you're in town for more than one day, be sure to visit Signal Hill at many times of day. My favorite was at night, when I could see the city reflected in the harbor, and on a very foggy afternoon, when we couldn't see much past our hands. This place is magical!

Excellent view of the harbor. It gives you a three hundred and sixty view of St Johns Harbour. The gift shop had a good selection of St Johns souvenirs.

Interesting historical place in Newfoundland. Pay attention to weather as this is obviously a geographically high location and with the wind and the northern latitude, it can be very chilly up there. The view is outstanding. It's a must see while in St. Johns.

Signal Hill is a great place to visit, it is free for everyone so that is a nice gesture. The weather was great so the vista's were also great.
The title of this review sums up my experience walking the trails around Signal Hill. A must see if in St. John's, I hope to visit again.
This is a must visit to see the view of the city of St. John's, the narrows and the ocean. Spectacular!
The eastern-most point of North America Nature at its best Great exercise for the body, soul, eyes and taste buds. MASSES OF WILD BLUEBERRIES

Signal hill is one of the places that you need to go if you're visiting st. John's. It is absolutely spectacular and will not disappoint.

I really enjoyed this day in St. John's .. I spent the whole day exploring the tower and hiking around.The hike.. Wow it was simply breathtaking .. Signal Hill has some of the most beautiful trails in such easy access from St. Johns. ....because it is famous for wind, and if you're a lightweight, you'll feel like you're about to be blown out to sea....the vistas are worth the walk....and there are good paths for strolling or hiking....there's also a gift shop on site, plenty of parking and it's free.....

our friends took us to Signal Hill the evening before we left Newfoundland. We didn't have alot of time that day to sightsee but they wanted to make sure we at least got to Signal Hill. Amazing! Very nice trail, lots of nice places for taking pictures! Just loved it! :-) Wear comfortable shoes!

Came to St. John's for business expecting nothing - customer took me to signal hill - newfound respect for this beautiful land - attraction spotless , very well maintained. Great gift shop

We went on a bus our with McCarthy's. Our tour guide John was informative and a wealth of knowledge about the region and best restaurants around the area.

amazing views. We parked at the bottom and did the full hike. Can be taxing, but if you take your time you will be happy. Bring your camera

Don't miss this beautiful view of St. John's and surrounding area from atop the hill. Just beautiful!!

Beautiful vantage point to read and understand the maritime history of Saint John' s. Be sure to leave plenty of time to take advantage of the trails. The view is something to behold from signal hill and then to hear about the significance of Signal Hill and realize how far technology has come from this point is amazing, go back in time and see where communication beginnings started that changed the world!

a full 360 degree view of the harbor, the city, the surrounding rocky landscape and of course, the ocean. We were fortunate enough to add an iceberg to the view
