Signal Hill is a favorite relaxing spot of mine. I enjoy the scenery, the harbour, the eagles, the different ppl are all very interesting. Grab your sneakers, a water bottle and hit the trails!
Great views dress warm as it is very windy. Also good walking shoes are a must due to hill and trails.

We loved walking the trails around Signal Hill. We followed one out to a cliff and just a little ways down we saw a huge eagles nest with a baby in it. The parent eagles were flying back and forth from the nest. It was beautiful to be so close! The views are just stunning!
Definitely check this out, you can get some amazing views of the ocean and the city from the top of signal hill. Beautiful!!
Always beautiful to watch from the hill on both sides; St.John's looks beautiful at night and the Atlantic is breathless to watch. You have to be ready for the cold and the wind.
A must see on any trip to St. John's, NL. A great place for a hike on the doorstep of the Atlantic ocean.
Nice weather and good experience for kids! Lots of people visiting on that day, but still not to crowded!

What a great view of St. John's and Atlantic Ocean. Loved watching the ships come into port. I was not able to walk to miles of paths due to the ice, but will do so when I come back during the summer months.

Unfortunately, when we visited it was foggy and rainy which hurt the view, but it was still lovely. We went up Cabot Tower to get the highest vantage point. From there you had an excellent view of the harbour and also of the colourful houses of St John's. The gift shop in the Tower is worth a visit- some lovely...
An amazing view over the entire city both day and night. We walked in the afternoon and hired a car in the evening.

Signal Hill is a 'must see' in St. John's, as the location of the receipt of the first trans-Atlantic wireless signal. It also has various trails with great views of the entrance to St. John's harbour (and the adjacent Atlantic). Whales can sometimes be seen, as can the offshore fog bank (and sometimes sea ice). The back side of the...

The first day we went to Signal Hill it was quite foggy and we still thought it was quite nice. The next day we had some extra time and decide to go back and take a look. I am so happy we did because the views of the harbour were quite amazing. We were able to view the ships in...
I really enjoyed my visit to Signal Hill! So much history, awesome views, a great little gift shop and friendly staff!
Signal Hill is beautiful. The views of the ocean are fantastic. Especially when it's ice burg season
If you interest to see the best view of atlantic ocean with cliffs , do not doubt, this palace is the best view.

Signal hill was fantastic--gorgeous view and absolutely worth it (even with the windchill of a sunny February day). However, we walked up. And when I say we walked up, I mean I was reminded of why even thinking about the word 'callisthenics' makes me sweat. Yes, I was out of breath. Yes, I am out of shape. But yes, I...

If you visit Signal Hill be prepared to be disappointed, being from Newfoundland I am fully aware of how our weather can be unpredictable and often poor. So, if you are travelling here from another Province, Country etc and are expecting beautiful weather, you may be setting yourself up for disappointment.In saying that, the other 75% of the time...
The view is amazing! It shows the wonderful colors of the city and holds a lot of history. The hiking trail is also beautiful during the summer! If you are able to do it be sure to take your camera!
It's historical, the view us the best one you can see the city and Cape Spear, Fort Amherst and it's free! What's not to love!

Signal Hill is the best free thing you can do in St. John's. There are lots of hiking trails that will bring you to come very unique places. It's a great place to take a lunch with friends and enjoy the view.
In walking around Signal Hill, you cannot escape feeling the past. The views are magnificent. The trails are excellent.

This is a must visit if you are in St John's. Signal Hill offers a spectactular view of the city and Harbour Front, especially at night. Then, when you look out over the broad expanse of ocean, you realize just how far east you really are. You may be lucky enought to see a whale or a boat. You feel...

It's beautiful and in the midst of the city; especially close to downtown. There's a meandering trail that leads you along the coast and up the hill, and will require some nerve in a place or two. If you're a little less ambitious, get a cab up the hill, enjoy the view, and take the same hiking trail down. PS....

While Signal Hill offers a tremendous view of North America's oldest City, it also gives the visitor the opportunity to realize just how "Far East" St. John's is. Looking to the right you will see not only a vibrant, modern city, but the history that comes with being a 500 hundred year old port town. When you look to your...
This is well worth the visit if you are in Newfoundland. Another absolutely stunning view of the Ocean. Gift shop on site.
A truly impressive spot, wild, beautiful, with history, wildlife, walking trails, whales, wild blueberries....wild Canada at its best.

Dress warmly against the sea air and enjoy a daytime "look" or a night time view of the lights of the City!The walk down from Cabot Tower around the Battery Path is challenging and only for the surest footed or mountain goats~don't try this if you don't like heights or slippy footing next to sheer cliffs.Always beautiful!
Even though I live close to St. John's I often visit Signal Hill in the summer. The view is breathtaking and the icebergs are amazing. There truly is no place like home!
Fantastic view and very historic site. The hike around the hill is very scary in spots but a "not to be missed" adventure.

Signal Hill is a must for anyone visiting St. John's. The view of the city is amazing and tso is the history including Marconi's first wireless message and the battles between the French and the British in the 1700's. Don't forget to check out the GEO Centre.

There are great walking trails all around Signal Hill, and theGEO Center.Obey the signs that are posted, in reference to the trails that are closed from late Fall, until Spring. That is the trail where there are lots of steps,that bring you down from the hill to The Battery area.Or, you can start at The Battery, and...

Fabulous view of the city, the harbour and the ocean. Can't go to St. John's without a visit to Signal Hill.LOVED St. John's would go back every year, if it didn't take a life time in travel to get there and back.
History for sure. Marconi making the first wireless signal from the top of the hill in st john's all the way across the water to England..
great place to visit look out for miles ,,,,lots of history ,,you can actually feel part of it just looking around ,,,
There can't be many places in the world when you can view icebergs this close to a major urban centre. Very impressed!
Beautiful...don't miss out...we visit here every time we are in St. John's and do the hike around the hill...

The view of St. John's from the hill is wonder filling especially when you look back at the twisting road you have travelled. The weather can be a little windy even on a calm day, so dress warm even on the hottest summer day or you will find yourself exiting the hill before you see all of the sites. The...
Perfect place for a short easy walk or a difficult long one. Fantastic when the icebergs are in and the whales are around.

I have been here many times and living close by.This tourist attraction is rich in history from being the first place to send a trans atlantic telegraph to battles.But it also offers great views of St.johns,Iceberg,whalewatching and the most amazing hike around the cliffs.Its it better then any workout in a gym!

We were visiting our daughter who is at Uni in St Johns. We all went up to Signal Hill and had a good look around. The information boards about the surrounding area's were a wealth of knowledge, just a pity Cabot tower was not open due to the time of year. Wee will have to visit again as it looked...

I'm a local, we live downtown and we regularly hike signal hill. It's the perfect amount of time (depending on your speed it can take anywhere from 30 mins to 2 hrs). It's great cardio, wonderfully challenging uphill climbs ( all stairs, just steep!).For visitors, wear proper exercise clothing, especially shoes! Not suitable for young children or dogs. A...
It's such a beautiful view I'd be sure to see it. Such a wonderful panoramic view of St. John's makes you really appreciate its history. Such a colorful city.

(Or more correctly, kilometres.)To walk to the top of Signal Hill and stand looking out to sea, to look over at Cape Spear in the distance, to feel the wind blowing in off the Atlantic, to look over St John's - it's an amazing feeling.We walked up from St John's in the snow. It is a fair walk,...

A wonderful seascape and historical site at the far eastern edge of the American Continent. The first transatlantic wireless message was received here by Marconi. Icebergs in Spring , whales in summer. Windy always. A wonderful hike - or go by car.
Went there to see the tatoo. It is Worth seeing and it is only on certain day. They have a shop where you can purchase items. If you are there at noon, they shoot a canon off.
Drove up on New Years day to see the lights of St Johns, it was beautiful and very windy. Pitch dark with the waves crashing one way and sparkling lights the other.
Fantastic view out over the North Atlantic and vantage point to view St. John's for photography. Watch ships leaving St. John's and entering the very protected harbour port via "The Narrows"

My first visit ever to Newfoundland my daughter brought me here the evening I arrived, 12/24/14 and it was a spectacular glimpse of St. John's. We revisited in many types of weather over the next two weeks and it was exhilarating. I felt reassured that almost everywhere we went I could look over and see Cabot Tower in the distance.
The view, the view! The view of St. John's is awesome, and I got some great photos! A must stop if you are visiting St. John's, Newfoundland.
My partner, his brother, and I hiked Signal Hill during our visit to St. John's in October. The scenery was breathtaking. Lots of fun!

When I went, the building was closed but the views and the well maintained walking paths around the area are really good.If it's cold out then really do watch out for the wind. When I was there is was -10 deg C but with wind chill it got below -20! So be warned.Make sure to take time and...
Great views and wonderful history any time of the year! This is by far the best view of St John's Harbor!
I love how it's in the middle of the city. Staff and visitors were friendly, but of course, we're in Newfoundland;). Breathtaking view from the top.
Watch the sun rise over the Atlantic - or the early morning sun poke through the clouds. A beautiful view out to sea and along the coast

This historic property sits up high overlooking the oldest city in North America to the west and the magnificent expanse of the Atlantic Ocean to the east. History, character, beautiful vistas and friendly staff and people make this an essential part of your visit to Newfoundland.

Signal Hill is one of those places that seems to appeal to locals and tourists alike, or as I say, "people from home, and people from away." Or to use other phrases I've heard all my life, people from places other than Newfoundland are often referred to as being "from up along" or "up across." No matter where you're from...

This review may be a little biased as I live in St. John's but I always enjoy taking a little trip up to Signal Hill. The trails make or a good hike and if you start from downtown and walk all the way up you will be feeling it.On the few clear days or nights we have here in...
A short drive from downtown St. John's and its worth taking a look. What a great view of the city and an interesting part of history.

One of the most beautiful sights I've seen! Great spot to go to clear your head at night. Or during the day to take pictures. Great view of the ocean on one side and all of St. John's on the other side!

I've been up here a few times at different times of the year. Even in the heights of summer it does be as windy and sometimes really cold up on Signal Hill, but saying that it is really beautiful and lovely trails around it. When it does be to windy they close the stairs up onto the look out on...
I really liked the view of St. Johns harbour from here. There were lot's of icebergs also this summer. I will be back sometime.

It took me about 35 minutes climbing from St.John's downtown to Signal Hill. It's a long way walking (you must have good legs) but both the view and the monument itself are marvellous! I was in a cruise ship and the first thing i did after arriving to St.John harbour was to climb to Signal Hill. After arriving there you...
Great Views. Great Memories with family. Loved the gift shop too! Bought a Newfoundland cookbook there!
The view the area the walk all were enjoyable. A visit to St. John's would not be complete unless you visit Signal Hill
Easily accessible by car. No fee. Best place to overlook St-John's city and harbor... if there's no fog!
So much history....loved it! We took a tour and had such a wonderful tour guide.....thanks, Larry! The views were spectacular!

Signal Hill is great for a nice hike. They have several trails around the hill and one of them is pretty challenging. The view is worth every minute of it though. Even if you just go up to Signal Hill and look over the edges of the parking lot, it's amazing.A must see!!!There is only one negative and...
In a word "WOW" my review could not give justice to the majestic sights and views! A definite must see for anyone travelling to NFLD!

When visiting St. John's on a clear day, there's no better place to visit than this place. Amazing view of the city and our harbour, truly magnificent when cruise ships are sailing in through the narrow. In early summer you can see the many whales and icebergs that is sure to impress. On a clear day you can easily see...

Amazing views of St. John's and the harbour area. Not for the faint of heart or those with physical limitations . If you take the long walk around the hill along the harbour it's awesome but dangerous . Don't wear flip flops as it can be slippery. One wrong step and its 100ft down to the ocean. Lots of history...

The view of the big ice bergs was a first for us and wonderful spot to take pictures. We went in to the Tourist Information Centre, and looked at the many interesting things to see and do while in St John's, we also walked up to the craft shop and bought several great souvenirs to take home to our family...

Spectacular views over 100 stairs for excellent aerobics and nice walking trails... it would b impossible to eliminate all dangers of a rocky cliff but definitely needs to b noted that there are very steep cliff edges and rocks that can come loose. I have lost someone I love this way and would like to warn any and all visitors...

The Cabot Tower is at the top of a hill overlooking the harbour and the city. There was bright sunshine the day we were there (although there was also a very stiff breeze). It was interesting to walk around the Tower, then to walk along some of the paths that went along the cliffs above the ocean. It's a not-to-be-missed...
I love Signal Hill. The scenery of St. John's, the Battery, and ocean side including Cape Spear is just wonderful. I live in St. John's and am blessed that I can visit this place as often as I can.
What amazing view and Be sure to check out the visitor center too! Great video InThe history of the site.
Interesting plaques along the path giving the history. Views of the harbour as well as the sea are spectacular.

It took us some 50+ years to make this trip by car but it was worth every second. This was a place of gorgeous scenery, history and tranquility. Never having seen icebergs before this was a fantastic bonus for us.This is a trip that left us with memories to last a lifetime. I would strongly suggest that anyone who can,...

Probably one of the most popular attractions in St. John's (George Street being the top) Signal Hill is must. The views from the top are stunning whether your looking our towards the city or the foggy sea. The building itself is small but rich with history, however as an outdoor enthusiast I have to say I loved the trail the...
If you are planning a visit to Signal Hill take the trail up. Its great. If you are not into the physical aspect then walk down. It took me about 35 minutes to go up. Its worth the hike.
a must on a visit to avalon. nice view over st. johns on a nice day. if you have to decide cape spear or here - forget about cape spear.
We did the hike up along the cliffs to Signal Hill and the views are beyond spectacular, though the hike itself it not for the faint of heart.

This is a must if you are visiting St. John's. We hiked up to the top of Signal Hill twice and it was amazing. There is a lot to see along the way up and we definitely got a workout in. So if you do the hike, prepare to put some work it. The views are incredible and the history...
Canadian history at it's finest. Park at the bottom and hike up the hill along the shoreline. It will give you and your family a much better experience and appreciation of the history and site.
We did not tour the tower but the views are life changing, the stunning cliffs and view of the ocean and harbour are just ridiculous. It is very easy to get to and a must see if in NL

This is the place where the first two way trans atlantic telegraph message was sent from in 1903.Signal hill, it's name says it well. When ships were sailing in from Europe signal flags alerted the city. Years later it was used to notify major merchants that one of their company ships was sighted.In WW1 and WW2 the surrounding...

This is a great historical site that is great to explore. It is a great hiking area and is unmatched for the view of the city and surrounding cliffs and ocean. Highly recommend seeing this site, especially when Cabot Tower is open.
so beautiful..... even in the fog.... highly recommend. view of the beautiful city. Cabot tower and it's history had me very impressed.

One can drive up to the hill and take in the vistas and if you don't mind a bit of adventure, one can get on the trail and walk around in a big loop to lower St. John's. The walk is not for the faint of heart or is accessible for persons with physical challenges. There are few guard rails...

If you think you can get up there (car, bus bike or foot) do go, just remember to take note of the weather and be prepared. If the wind is too strong they close the visitors centre because it is dangerous.In scientific terms, this is a historic site, being where Marconi received the first transatlantic radio signals. They were...

I walked here from downtown, up Signal Hill Road, and then returned along the coastal trail. The walk back was most impressive. Good photo opportunities throughout. Well worth a visit whilst in St John's.

Signal Hill is a remarkable place. The stone building is a beautiful sight all by itself, but then you get to look around!! Telegraph Hill provides a panoramic view of St. John's on one side and the Atlantic Ocean on the other side. It is truly a must see sight in St. Johns.

Visiting on the cruise liner Balmoral we took an excursion which included Signal Hill. The views over the harbour, the Narrows and out to sea are stunning and the story boards that are dotted about provide an interesting narrative of events in the past.

Being at the top of Signal Hill gives the nicest view of St. John's. There isn't much to do there, but if you are looking to take pictures it's probably the best place to do it. If you are interested in Canadian History it's also a place for you.

I go up to Signal Hill every time that I am in St. John's. I will never get tired of the beauty and how fresh the air is. The scenery whether looking out at the Ocean or looking towards the city is great. The Tower is great to get an even better view

I have always wanted to see NFLD and finally found a tour. There is so much history on "The Rock". Landed in Deer Lake then traveled all down the east coast. Such quaint little fishing communities, great museums, breathe taking views. The most friendly people in the world.I highly recommend a trip to NFLD. Be prepared to play an...

Quite apart from the brilliant views of St. John's and the ocean, this landmark is rich in history. Signal Hill is a hill which overlooks the city of St. John's, Newfoundland. You can drive up to the top and park (or walk up to Cabot Tower). Given its location overlooking the harbour it has served as a military stronghold since...
Best look out this side of BC other than CN Tower. Try to get up there both in the day time and during the night. St. John's is much larger than you'd expect
A must see when visiting St. John's. Easily to access, even to walk if you have the energy. A breath taking view of St. John's and its harbor.
Definitely worth seeing...the most beautiful view, walking trails and several historic markers. Went into the Cabot Tower where there is also a gift shop with very reasonably priced keepsakes.
Amazing view,sometimes a bit windy. A must do for tourists.A great walk, but be careful on the steps when walking down and up the path.

Its often very windy up there, but its a great place to see if you're in St. John's! And there is a nice hiking trail going around the hill. I recommended 2-3hrs to see the site if you are looking to do the hike.

Overlooking the narrows (see photo), the harbour entrance to St John's the views are impressive as is the history of the 1st transatlantic morse coded transmission. If the weather was poor you would see or experience little so please weather watch and even if it is good wrap up.Informative plaques in abundance this is a historic little gem.No...
Fabulous views with interesting historical markers.Small gift shop with reasonable prices. Worthwhile for a quick stop.

It was a bright sunny afternoon, and I asked a taxi driver just outside of our hotel if he would take us up to Signal Hill to see the Cabot Tower, he said he would give us a good price and up we went. We stopped about halfway up and walked around to take pictures, The view is "fantastic" with...
Terrific waterfront trail is the best way to approach this historic site of wireless pioneer Marconi.
Great view on St John's and over the countryside. Very close to downtown, you could even walk up there.
On the edge of St. John's and its harbor. Great historical significance. Great view of the harbor and downtown St. John's. One of the windiest places on the island.

When you drive up to the car park you just cannot believe you are up so high - you can even see over to the airport. The Visitor Centre caf was closed which was a blow as we were longing for a coffee.
Great view of harbour and historical review of first trans-Atlantic wireless broadcast. Gift shop on site of course.
the view of the ocean and the harbor were awesome and worth the climb! the history of Marconi and the wireless transmission was something we hadn't realized was such a big deal.

We were fortunate to find Lucille Conway of Heritage Tours available at the port of St. John's on our arrival on the Ruby Princess. Our scheduled tour was cancelled which gave us the chance to tour the city and surrounding area with Lucille. Lucille was a wealth of information and extremely accommodating. As a small group we were able to...

I was shocked to find out that it was free to go to the top of the tower at signal hill! I was expecting a fee of some sort. Bring your hiking shoes and a picnic and enjoy the many trails and awesome photo opportunities.

Cabot Tower is a "must-see," the park is well-planned, and the information boards plentiful. There are lots of walks and hikes that connect to this park. We visited on Friday, the day after a large cruise ship arrived, and getting in to visit the tower was challenging as there were hundreds of visitors.

I was excited to be able to visit Signal Hill during a visit last week to St. John's. The walk up to the Marconi tower was breathtaking, in that the view over the coastline was spectacular. Reading the story of the first wireless transmissions from the UK to this point was amazing. With a beautiful lookout point, it was a...
We loved that we could just wander around the area, enjoy the gorgeous views of the city and the ocean,

Interesting history adequately introduced by the information boards scattered around near Cabot Tower, great views of the harbour and a number of walks around the battery and further along the coast. The gift shop at Cabot Tower isn't too bad either, as tourist gift shops go, with some interesting knick-knacks and books on local history.

Signal Hill is a Canadian National Historic Site where Guglielmo Marconi received the first transatlantic communication, the letter "S" in morse code in 1901. There is the Cabot Tower you can climb that is a small museum describing the event. There is a Noon Day Cannon and best of all an incredible view of the city, the lighthouse, as well...

went up to signal hill at night thinking we would have the place to ourselves..........not! Lots of people taking advantage of the beautiful view overlooking the city and the harbour. It's quite nice during the day, and is full of history, but take a trip up in the evening, its worth the drive.
The views on signal hear are excellent and a must see if you are visiting St. John's. There is a walking trail along the cliffs and water.
Its very easy to get to if you have a car. Free parking. The view of St. John's and the harbor is the best. On a clear day you can see nearly the entire city. Worth the drive and the time.

This was the last thing we did as part of our visit to St John's and it put the whole locality and geography into context. Superb views to be had made even better by a clear sky and a setting sun. Well worth the visit.
Very helpful friendly staff. Gave us a map to find our way around the streets of St. John's. Lovely views of the ocean.

Signal Hill was one stop on a tour we went on around st john's but we knew we had to come back so we could do the hike back to the city. We did go back the next day and it turned out to be the highlight of our weekend. We took a cab from where we were staying to...
Historic site with a great view of St John's and Fort Amherst. Can be very windy but that helps keep the mossies flying.

The view is soooo amazing from every angle. Signal Hill is about 3 minutes drive from the main street It was beyond my expectation; words and pictures can't describe how stunning it was this beauty. We got a map from the visitor center,from there we drove to parking lot to park the car then just follow the trail. We just...

Great place to explore and read the historical signs along the way. Very windy, but great views of the city. Great pics of St Johns from here. Lots of paths and stairs to explore. Recommend good shoes. The souvenir shop is good and the prices are reasonable if you into that type of thing. the stairs to the lookout are...

I hiked up the hill with a friend and it has such amazing views! Some of the staircases were a struggle but it was worth it when you get to the top.Beware of the second last staircase from the top...it is so steep and never ends!

Bring your camera with all your lenses for you will need every shot you can get. You need a super zoom to get the details of the precious water smashing into the rocks that is just breath taking. From atop of signal hill you can over see St. John's in a way that is not possible from downtown. Would recommend...

column3: St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
column4: I enjoy walking the trails around signal hill. it provides a beautiful view of the city. nice place to go when you are looking for icebergs.
Excellent information boards, hiking trails throughout area and Cabot Tower. Views of Cape Spear Lighthouse, Fort Amherst Lighthouse, the Narrows, St. John's Harbor, St. John's cityscape, etc....

Just walked the trail starting from QuidaVida up the steep rocks to signal hill then continued ahead down the rocky shore line with exceptional views back to military St . in St . John's seems like we walked miles not for the feint of heart
Great to go there and go inside the building all free of charge ! Great views and not too much walking
The view from all sides of Signal Hill are great. It gives you a good overview of the city. The history behind Signal Hill was quite interesting for me....not so much for my wife.

Beautiful sceneries and great walking trails. Make sure to visit Cabot tower and walk (from the inside) to the top - great views. Also, from the tower, trails lead down to the batteries. It's worth the walk. If your in for some walking, do the North Head trail. You won't reget it.
A bit of a hike but the views are great even at night! Easy drive and good parking the trip up the top of tower is worth it it's very interesting to read about Marconi and his transatlantic message!

2 to 2.5 hour hike around the cliffs of St. John's. The hike takes you down some steep stairs and around fantastic views as you hike along the cliffs of the Atlantic Ocean. You could do it shorter, and there seem to be lots of people there who do it daily; but stop to admire the vistas! It is a...
very worthwhile to see especially if the weather is nice. nice view on the ocean, coast and St John's. Very close to downtown St John's
We went on a very windy day so the tower was closed but we did very much enjoy the visitor center, the "soldiers" reinacting drills, the trails and the views.
beautiful view of lovely st. john's. lots of history up there. lovely walking trails, close to where the titanic sank.

This hill is a wonderful place to watch the ocean. Under the sun shine the deep blue waster and bright white ice burger make a good contrast. Usually it is a very windy place. It is not green enough. Should be greener.

This was the best part of our trip. We stayed in the Battery area and walked to the trail from the front step of our apartment. The trail was an experience I'll never forget. The views became more and more beautiful as we walked. We did the hike everyday of our trip. Be sure to stop into buy water along...
Wonderful view of St.Johns and the ocean! We did not have time to walk up, but it seemed like a really nice hike.

Do not miss out on Signal Hill! We got lucky when we went as it was a very clear day. We drove most of the way up and then parked and hiked the rest of the way. It was our first full day in St. John's so we were very excited and Signal Hill did not disappoint. The scenery literally...
We enjoyed the view from top of the Signal Hill, and we could see Cape Spear light house in the distance. Definitely worth the drive to the top.
Signal Hill where Marconi transmitted the radio signal from. Extremely cold and windy (October) so make sure you dress in warm clothes. The views from up here are incredible.
We went there the day we arrived. It was windy and rainy and we still loved it. Very very interesting and well presented. You are given a lot of information. I think it is important to see it.
very informative and scenic...views of the bay and of the city are worth the visit...walking trails available...history of the town & great fire in pictues on the boardwalk
Great ocean views and rugged coastline. Great historical site with Marcone museum. Beautiful views of St. John's harbour and the waterfront area
I visited the area while I was in the province for work. It had amazing history,sights,people and the night view was beautiful. I learned a lot and the walking/running trails give a great workout.

Beautiful place, fresh clean air coming from the North Atlantic Ocean. Rich in history and culture. Make this place a stop for sure, early morning visit you will be one of the first people to see the sun rise in the western world, worth getting up for.

I really like this place. The view really is incredible of the St John's Harbour and downtown area. There are many nice walking trails all around if you like walking. For those that prefer to just look down at the city below and take in the view that's fine too. This attraction is top notch, don't miss seeing it.
being so high up you can see so much of the beautiful scenery around St. John's. You can visit day or night you still enjoy it
From Signal hHll, you can see all parts of St. John's harbor & the city. It is beautiful & different at night & during the day, but windy!
I was here in 1975 and just returned this July. Of course it didn't change much since it's been there for hundreds of years. Still a great site and historically significant.
No matter when you visit, expect wind. If you hike, the trails are good but the lower trail would be a challenge to those less fit.

What a great place to go to visit. Much more than the place of Marconi's 1st transatlantic wireless transmission. View was tremendous - in mid-June the first of the ice bergs were coming through. There are several walking paths and some will take you right down to the shore-be ready to go up and down the hill. The visitor's center...
The site is deservedly the is on many tourist brochures. We recommend it to everybody visiting St.John's.
So much to see and do! The views and scenic trail are amazing. An interesting history lesson to be found amongst all the different spots with in Signal Hill, a must see when in St. John's

Such beautiful views. The weather was amazing. We just can't get enough of those wonderful trails around the hill. If we lived in St. John's we would be there most evenings. It wouldn't take you long to get into great shape with all those trails.
Stunning view of St. John's and harbour and the view up and down the coast in the other direction. Very windy up top.

The trip to the hill was excellent. I had been once before but didn't have enough time to properly explore. This visit I lost track of time and spent about 2 hours.The signage describing historical events was informative. Short trip up the hill and the view is incredible. The story of the structure is neat as well. It gets very windy up there and in the winter time can almost be unbearable. Check it out

This is a great site to get a quick glimpse of the history of the area while enjoying incredible views of the Atlantic, St. John's and the oft guarded narrows. Of course it was foggy and drizzly. Bring a good rain coat and umbrella and a warm sweater. Ask for the guided tour with Kelsey if she is working.

We didn't leave anything like enough time to see this place properly, I'm sorry to say. It's a popular place with locals and tourists alike, for an energizing hike, walking the dog, or just taking in the wider view of the city.

We walked to the tower via the harbor walk - this was excellent and we made it with a 3 year old child who walked 80% of the way. We visited the tower - which has a great historical importance and also great views! We took the bus back in to town, which was good value. Although note you need...

I walked up along the coastal path, which offers interesting insights into the St John's fishing industry. As you rise up the hill, the views get increasingly spectacular. If you are lucky enough to get a clear day in St John's, you MUST walk up this.
The view of the city and harbour is fantastic. Make at least two visits once during the day and another at night.

We can't honestly tell you much, because when we went, the weather was awful. It was foggy, and we could see the road and the visitor's building, but little else. If the weather is nice, I'd have to refer you to the other reviews here. If it's foggy, find something else to do (like Cape Spear which had better conditions...

We climbed Signal Hill on our first day in St. John's and were rewarded with excellent views of the city and the sea.The hike up offers some great attractions sobbing the way including the Geo Center and Tattoo (parade ground by visitor center). A must when visiting St John's...Tips...wear comfortable enclosed shoes because the trails are mostly gravel; the weather can change quickly (we had sun fog rain wind all within 15 minutes and this continued for the 3 hours we spent there) so have some extra clothing on hand; bring your own food and drinks since there is almost nothing available...
Scenery is beautiful, tower is interesting. I always like a gift shop! Trails around there will provide lots of views

I went to Cabbot Tower at Signal Hill and walked the North Head Trail, which wraps along the hill. The trail offers a breathtaking view of the coastline and the walk down the trail was exhilarating.However, the trail is not for the faint of heart, and you need to be fully alert. We didn't tour the lighthouse itself, but the drive up the hill and views over St. John's were very nice.

We went up in the parking wiout our large RV without problem. We visited the interesting museum about history of the area. We have a very nive view of sea and landscape, and city harbour. Anyone should start St-Johns visit by going there first!

Awesome view of the St. Johns harbour. Enjoyed the walk up to the lookout and the walk down to the cannons. Went off trail and got a little bit muddy in the bog, so recommend staying on the trails!

I never get bored of returning to Signal Hill/Cabot Tower. The views are always spectacular! A must on your visit to St. John's. Very windy so you may need a light jacket/sweater. You can spend as little or as long a you like.

A place combined history and stunning view to the harbor and port. We went there on later afternoon with a light frog, which created fantastic view to the harbor and bay. We walked around all of the tops of the hill and also bought a few gift on its gift shop on the signal tower. It was very lucky for...

Seemed to be a beautiful spot.View was limited due to heavy fog but everything else was lovely. Nice lookout over St. John's harbor too!!
Awesome place to spend time. A great place to find a beautiful view and/or a nice walk. Its usually packed, but barely anyone would be heard complaining. The gift shop is very expensive, though.
Fantastic view on a clear day. Check the weather before going. St Johns tends to have lots of sea mists.
Close to downtown St. John's. Loved the views of the city. Easy to get to. Lots of paths and trails to access.
Head on up and just walk around, you have great wraparound views of the city of St Johns and the waterways. There's a visitors centre too but we didn't go in there,
not really my cup of tea due to the crowds, but it's worth nipping up the hill to check out the view.

I had the good fortune to visit Signal Hill during a clear morning. The views of St. John's Harbour and the ocean are spectacular. The site has sufficent interpretive panels to understand the importance of this site. I saw that there were hiking trails below and I wish I had more time to enjoy these hiking trails. The first stop on the hop-on hop-off...very interesting history and great views...even the rain shower could not spoil it!

Newfoundland is a beautiful Province. Signal Hill has wonderful vistas and worth the trip up for the scenic views and history of the place. Doesn't take a long time so factor in other things to do for your day. We included a trip to Cape Speare and a lunch downtown.

History, views of St. John's harbour and the ocean, walking trails. It's a great spot to visit. You can drive right up to Cabot House, or you can hike it. Close to other attractions. No entrance fees.
Hard work to get to top on a hot day but views are 'must see' good trails from top to get back to town. Good first point of call as can see city & get bearings

A short drive from St. John's and you will find yourself on the most eastern point of North America with the beautiful Atlantic stretched before you. excellent views of St. John's. Cabot House had superb backgrounder on Marconi's first trans-Atlantic transmission. A worthwhile experience -- a MUST SEE.
you will be soar, so take a cab up and walk down then go for dinner in the harbour, the walk will take you about 1hr 1 way...

Great fun hiking up the hill. If you go far enough up you can watch the tatoo for free! It was really windy on top so not overly enjoyable. I didn't really get to read much history but it is quite iconic for the area. Glad we went!

Beautiful location ...whales were spotted off the coast....great view of St. John's Harbour....the staff were helpful and friendly and one gent who was a security guard spent over 45 minutes talking to us about the coast

As part a short stopover in St. John's, we visited the Signal Hill historical site. It was definitely worth the stop. MUST SEE SPOT!! You can walk up from downtown or drive (like me) the car up. Incredible view of St John's harbour, downtown, Cape Spear, Ireland and France. Always a few whales to be seen off shore.

The view is spectacular! We made a visit one morning, then again at night to see all the lights, and then again with a picnic lunch. We couldn't get enough. Well, it was a nice view and neat that we could climb the inside of the building and go to the roof.Wished St. Johns would invest more into their heritage and update their message boards and install AC into their buildings. I could not even enjoy the site because it was so hot inside the building.

I received a guided walking tour up to Signal hill and thoroughly enjoyed learning about the factual history of the location (e.g. Marconi) versus common misconceptions. Alice was a great guide. The view of the Harbour and St John's is spectacular. Saw some whales out on the ocean. Walking trails all over the place. A definite must do!!
A great place to visit for its history and views of the ocean and St John's . Must place to visit when in Avalon peninsula.

Just an amazing time thanks staff very friendly needs to be a washroom up there maybe a port a potty one for sure please replace signs thanks

I couldn't believe how little money the government charged for this place, and that was for the exhibits!The view up at the tower was amazing and breathtaking. Even on a foggy and rainy day it was quite clear to see everything in downtown St. John's. A must do here!

We stayed at the Sheraton close to Signal Hill. The first time we took a cab up to the hill, which is only 5 minutes by car and then walked back about 25-30 minutes pausing to enjoy the stunning views overlooking St. John's harbor, the ocean and passing icebergs. Seriously beautiful landscape. Gorgeous spot. Now to the serious stuff!! Coordinate the hike with two cars. It is so much more enjoyable. I have to write so many bits of info to move on...You can not describe Signal Hill untill you are there.

I've been to Signal Hill a couple times and have never been disappointed. Whether you're looking over the ocean, or facing the harbour of St. John's, the view from the hill is amazing. Would recommend seeing it during the day as well as at night, as the city lights of St. John's is a pretty cool sight.Cute little gift...
I walked the road up to Signal Hill, then took the East Coast trail down. It was stunning. Highly recommended.

Signal Hill has the best views of the city. I've been here many many times and the views never get old. It's amazing!

So much history here. On a clear day it is just gorgeous. Always seems to be windy every time I have been there. This is a don't miss photo op if you are in St Johns.

Today was a perfect day to go walking around signal hill, warm and breezy. Great place to view the entire city. Luckily we got to see some whales that were feeing out on the coast. We also saw the tattoo ceremony. Since you have to pay to see it we just watch from a nearby hill, was cool to see...

Strap on your shoes for this! A great walk around the harbor, very windy. Be prepared, bring something to drink (besides beer i mean)I love St-Johns

I drove up here to see the Cabot Tower and take in the best views of the city. You really must bring a camera and binoculars as there is so much to see; Downtown, Quidi Vidi, several lighthouses, the Battery, etc. There were also some marooned icebergs just outside the harbour and a silver fox patrolling the cliffs as an...

It's beautiful at Signal Hill. We walked up the hill and took the North Head Trail down. Another day, we walked up the trail. The trail offers amazing views. Both days we were there, it was super windy.
Incredible views of icebergs, the harbour and the city. Lots of local high school graduates pulling up in limousines and getting their pictures taken!
This very historic site is well worth the visit since it offers wonderful views of St. John's. It is only a 5 minute drive from downtown St. John's.

a Must-Go!There was NO way I was doing the long trail around but walking around the grounds and taking in the view was breathtaking.

hard to believe you can actually visit without paying (there is an extra charge for tour) but you can tour the grounds for no charge, close to the city - a must see if you visit St. Johns

A unique, natural site, right on the eastern-most edge of the East Coast North American Continent. Wow! Beautifully presented in high quality accessibility infrastructure, which allows the natural elements to shine. Supported by Trolley Bus service from Downtown. Memorable.

If you make it to this part of the country you definitely have to take in the views and beautiful walking trails. We loved walking the trails, the views and the ponds. Would go back, and next time would leave more time for the Geo Centre.

The scenery from Signal Hill is breathtaking. We had a car and were in St. John's for 7 days. We went up to Signal Hill 4 times. As long as there isn't too much fog up on Signal Hill, you're sure to have a beauty time! Sometimes you can even see icebergs! Go on b'y, what are you waiting for?!

Signal hill is a beautiful place above St. John's. It was the first place we visited while in town and we were not disappointed. The kids loved walking around and finding out what all the different buildings were for. Signal Hill is a beautiful spot with a spectacular view plus a number of attractions to see. Great place to see Icebergs from. Very busy area when I was there, hard to get parking at the top. Would go again

Nice walk / run around the coastal track. Signal Hill was better than I expected. There was a wonderful trail to the top if you chose to walk instead of drive. There was another trail when you got to the top that was worth the many stairs that you had to had to climb to get back to the parking lot. The view was spectacular; the icebergs amazing!
Hiking through the Battery and along the harbour coastline up to Signal Hill was a good work-out and fun, with great views of the city and ocean!

You can't miss this one from almost anywhere in St. John's. Amazing view from the top. Were able to see couple of huge icebergs from the hill. Trails are very good - worth going up there to have a birds eye view of St John's

it was a great area that catered to all lots of hiking trails well maintained great view especially when the iceburgs were there.one draw back are washroom facilities non existent after 5 and limited from 10-5

Worth visiting for the great views over St John's. Unfortunately, the museum was closed due to renovations when we were there

This is an historic as well as a visual jewel in St. John's. Be sure to stop by the visitors center before or after going up top. The views are spectacular both inland as well as out into the ocean. After a meeting with the Terry Fox memorial which is where we wanted to start out NL adventure we headed up to signal hill. It was very windy the day we were there but it was so nice. We walked some of the trails down to the battery and had fun taking pictures pretending we were shooting off the cannons....

This is a "must do" in St. Johns. Gorgeous views. Also hikes available on site, so if you want to take a long walk, make sure to wear your walking shoes for some long boardwalk trails and steps. Cute gift shop with some nice selections of tourist trinkets too.
Lots of history! Looks like it would have amazing hiking trails so bring a good pair of sneakers. It was a clear day so you can see for miles. Has a little gift shop.

Know that you can also hike/run from/to Signal Hill from town using the N Head Trail. I wouldn't recommend the trail with small children or the elderly....
Wonderful place to visit . Historically interesting. Lovely little shop with original items. Is really quite remote and can really only be accessed with a car and guide, if you are on foot.

What a beautiful view of the city of St. John's. It was very cold and windy and the lookout on top of the tower was closed.. but highly recommended as a must see when you're visiting this amazing city
Amazing views of coastline, icebergs, harbour and ships. A little cool with 6C and windy though expected it!!

I loved visiting Signal Hill / Cabot Tower. The foggy weather made it even more beautiful. Take the time to visit Signal Hill: the entire city of St. John's is laid out at your feet looking one way icebergs float by the other way. A bit of a hike to climb, but ample parking at the top if you want to drive.

This is one of the most beautiful sights to behold! You can drive right up to the top (at least you could in May) and see what St. Johns is all about! The view is spectacular, to say the least.There is a good gift shop there with lots of things to choose from.
Great views while hiking up to the top along the rugged trail. Give yourself about 1-2hrs and bring a camera!

It is a hike to get up the hill but you can drive as well. The views are stunning. There are trails all over the area. We went back there a few times to just watch the view. I did notice many locals would have lunch sitting in their cars taking part in the view. We saw a few Ice...
It's worth the short hike as you have a great view to enjoy. You might see some icebergs if the time is right. Nice gift shop too.

Great view of the city and Cape Spear the most Easterly point of North America.Cabot Tower is a historic location that has stood guard over the narrows and was where the first wireless sign a was sent from North America to Europe.

If you want a breath taking hike around Signal hill, a view of the Gorgeous St. John's harbour , or get a glimpse of history this place is for you! This tower and the city it sits in are both fabulous. Go. When you see the icebergs drifting by in June, it takes your breath away.

A wonderful hike in the summer for those who love to pause and take in the scenery on the way and don't mind walking up loads of steps. A great place also to watch the ships in the harbour as it provides a lovely view of the downtown waterfront. A Definite visit if you're in St John's!

Signal hill boasts a spectacular view. On one side we have our Atlantic ocean on the other our beautiful city. If you are an early riser you should take in the sunrise from this location. If you are health conscious and would like a challenging hike this is your spot. If you are a history buff you should know that...

See pictures for total trail ran. AMAZING views. Definitely go down the stairs to the low area east/southeast of the Signal Hill Historic Site parking lot. What a great day, beautiful trails, and a must do!
Great views of the city! It looks completely different when you at night and when you go during the day! I highly recommend doing both!

The view from Signal Hill is a must for any visitor, whether it's your first time or you umpteenth. Looking east out to sea is always different and beautiful. Great hiking trails around signal hill with spectacular views. great place to see icebergs from an intown albeit uphill location. wear warm clothing it's windy up there

Great site to see while in St. John's. It takes you higher than the city so you can take a peak of it all in one place. It allows you to see the brightly colors homes. !st wireless message received across the Atlantic ocean by Marconi on December 12, 1901. This event changed the world in communications worldwide. + you get a beautiful view of the Atlantic Ocean and the entrance to St. John's Harbour.
Amazing view of St john's harbour and city. The endless view of the Atlantic ocean is breathtaking. there is a beautiful walking trail around the hill that is a must do for the adventurous kind.
Great views on a clear day.Lots of history, watch the boats enter and exit St. John's harbour.Great walking trails and its l free of charge.
Signal Hill offers a commanding view of the open Atlantic to the east and in the opposite direction the Harbour and downtown of this historic city. A National Historic Site.
Great views, not a very difficult hike. Well marked and exceptional view of the city and harbour. Well marked trails and easy access.

One of the first activities we did in St John's was to stroll up the hill to visit this historical monument. There is a $5 shuttle too... The interpretation centre is midway up the hill and has a video and display for a very reasonable price (good sandwiches too!). The site itself is FREE to visit and cannot be missed...

Hiked it from top to bottom. SUCH nice views. The trails are a bit tight for people walking in both directions but it wasn't too busy. I recommend bringing water, something we forgot, and theres no where to really buy any. Worth the hike to see the views!
beautiful view of the harbor and downtown when the fog stays away. Easy to get to, Took a city tour which included it.

If you come to St. John's and don't go to Signal Hill you're going to miss the best view of the city, the Harbour and the Harbour entrance. The historical presentations are great too. The story of Marconi and the wireless are well presented. Depending on the time of year you might even see an iceberg.
The best place to overlook one of the world`s best natural harbors and to see how St. John's has grown.

While I love everything else about Signal Hill (hence the 4/5), my only drawback is that the nearest bathrooms are much further down the hill at the interpretation center. If this was fixed then it would be a 5/5!

So when my friend said we were going to be going DOWN Signal Hill I thought, alright, not so bad. It is incredibly hard to climb up or down but the accomplishment you feel afterwards and the views are priceless. I am TERRIFIED of steep, narrow stairs, going down, and really conquered my fear. Every time had to climb UP...
We were fortunate enough to visit on a beautiful clear sunny day. You can see for miles! Steps up to the top of the Cabot Tower are very steep but worth the climb :)

Absolute beauty. From here you feel like you can see anywhere. Off in the distance you can see Cape Spear. Turn and you can see all of St John's. Be prepared to hold on as the wind can sometimes be gusting hard.

We liked friendliness of the people. The cab drivers are very aware of the sites to see and the restaurants that serve the type of foods we liked. Chafe's Landing in Petty Harbour was the best place for seafood----especially cod fish and chips.

My family and I enjoyed signal hill and were in the area more than once. My elementary aged children and I walked a trail from signal hill through the battery and back up the hill. I would not recommend it for younger children as it is a strenuous walk taking a couple of hours and having a couple of areas...

Have been to Signal Hill several times over the years but this was the first time we were able to view the tattoo. This was about 30 minutes in length and although I cannot confirm this it appeared to us to be presented in general by students. They were extremely well dressed in period costumes and it was very interesting....

From the St. John's downtown area, it's easy to reach Signal Hill. The view from above is beautiful. My son, 8 years old, loved running around the outside viewing area. There are several boards with detailed information about the history and geography of St. John's. You can also go inside the tower, where they have a lovely gift shop and...

We hiked from Quiddi Vidi lake (across from the huge blue monstrosity, er, I mean, house) up to Signal Hill. Lots of stairs, and spectacular views. Not for the faint of heart, but then, there's no hurry. The trail goes down the other side to the harbor. A great way to spend the morning!

What a great spot! We visited Signal Hill a couple of times during the few days we had in St. John's. The first time we parked at the Visitors Centre and then hiked up to the hill. What views of the harbour and the ocean, looking towards Cape Spear. Boats and ships were coming in and out of the Narrows....

We thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon on Signal Hill. We parked at the lower level and walked up a dirt path to the top. There was a spectacular view of St. John's, the harbour and the ocean. We did not see any whales, but we were told by others that it is often possible to sight a passing whale. We enjoyed...

Great view of the harbour and the ocean. There is a cannon ceremony at noon daily in summer. There is a tattoo at the lower welcome center during the week according to a schedule. There is always a steady breeze in the evening so hold on to your hat.
We felt the Tattoo was worth the extra $ as the grandkids, and us, learned a lot. We particularly enjoyed the long, winding hiking trail to the base with beautiful vistas at every turn.

This is a national historic site you do not want to miss. It provides a truly spectacular view of St. John's and the ocean. This is where Marconi sent his first trans-Atlantic message. You an also see the "noon" gun".

If you are lucky the sun will shine! First transatlantic wireless message received here. Important Canadian historical site. Great views of St. John's, excellent trails. Definitely a warm(er) weather attraction due to the winds.

I love the scenery and the light house history we even seen whalesi spent a lot of time just spent staring out to the ocean and relaxing in the cool breeze and contemplating.A place to get lost in ones self

Great hike! It's visible on Googlemaps; there aren't any signs pointing you towards the trailhead to go up the hill, but people in the area are more than happy to set you in the right direction. For an average pace (4.5 - 5 km/h) for those of average fitness, it's an hour from bottom to top, including photo stops. It...
Very good 360 view with lots of informative plaques and helpful staff. The weather was cool and windy when we were there but vary glad we took the time to go.
Fantasic Canada Day watching the Tattoo! A lot of walking, up and down, but well worth the time! A must while in St. John's.

Not a lot of signs pointing you in the right direction but when you get there, wow. If you only want to take pictures and see the view, then a couple of hours ought to do it for you. I would recommend taking the whole day to visit this place. Start/park at the info centre and work from there. There...
An awesome spot to view the city and narrows. Great hiking area as well. Bring along a seater as the weather can change in a moment. Take time to visit Cabot tower.

One of the few attractions that you don't have to pay to go and visit. There are great walking trails at the bottom of Signal Hill if you are adventurous, and can follow the trail all the way to Duckworth street which will take you to downtown St. john's.
Excellent view. Save money and take the trolley line ($5) to get to the top and then walk the trails.
Very good interpretative center - we visited it twice as there is a lot to read. Lots of good hiking trails plus nice views of St John's and the harbour.

A very busy site with many people snapping, testing, and hiking. Appreciated the young man in the Newfoundland Regiment uniform who took the time to share bits of history and smile as photo after photo was taken with the visitors. There is no cost and well worth the drive, or hike up!

Signal hill is accessible both up a road or a lovely hike. The hike appears to start of some guys deck.....but around you go! The views of the Atlantic and St John's Harbor are amazing! I could literally spend all day gazing out to sea!

We could drive a good distance up the hill. Many of the locals love to walk and the weather was so nice that there were a lot of hikers and cyclists. It is not a place for people who have a walking disability or heart problems.

Went here as a part of a tour- would highly recommend that you drive up the hill vs. walking as its a long way up! Dress warm as its cold and windy! Also- try to pick a warmer, clear day to get the best views.There is a little bit of walking and stairs- the staircase up to the very...

We only had about 20 minutes to enjoy the location.We were here for the historical and geocache purposes.We loved the earthcache, loved the artillery cannons, loved the tower, and my son loved meeting the infantrymen from the Newfoundland Regiment (circa 1812).Inside, the Marconi telegraph exhibit was fun and the docent was well informed and helped my son...
A lovely spot to explore. Some great walking trails around the area, which we'll have to check out next trip. Be prepared for the weather to be colder up on the hill than it is in town.
The ocean view is everything they claim it is. They understate the wind, however. I am fairly large and it moved me at times. Great piece of history as well.

I frequent Signal Hill to photograph the sights. It's a beautiful location and a great place to get a view of the City of St. John's. Signal Hill has many trails with different levels of difficulty and I would recommend checking out the levels before starting out. If you are luck enough to time your visit you can hear the...
Ocean views, whales, sea birds, history, Queen Victoria, Marconi--this place has it all. Got only five minutes? Stop and take in the view. You will not be disappointed. It's the best of the best.

We arrived at signal hill the first day into our Newfoundland trip. We got there just before 1200pm and at noon they fired the cannon with a short re-enactment which was very cool. We spent a few hours hiking all around signal hill as there are several connecting trails around it. Great views, even saw a whale and a great...

St. John's is beautiful, but the view from Signal Hill is outstanding!A great place for a path walk overlooking the harbour. This is a photographers dream.A self guided tour of Cabot, along with a lovely gift shop. Enjoy, we (6) certainly did!

We walked along the waterfront and up the side of the cliffs. It's a pretty long walk and it's not good for kids or pets (mostly ok, but there are some steep bits and narrow bits). You can get a good view over St Johns (assuming no fog). The only con that we learned - pretty much everywhere in Nfld...

This location is teaming with history and if you are visiting you must visit. We took a cab up (the cabbie said we were the first people to do this) and then walked back down. You could walk both ways, but we had already walked alot that day and didn't need the exercise. The views are spectacular from there and...
Walked up the hill to see the sights from our hotel and we were not let down. Fab views of the city! A little windy up top though but a must see when in town.

Imagine seeing your city from a high vista. Toronto doesn't have anything like this, but lucky St.John's does. Signal Hill is a high vantage point from which you can see St. John's beautiful harbour, and at night, the sparkling lights of a booming city. Though on foggy days, which are many, it can be a challenge to see much, go...

Amazing views from all directions on this hill. The building is just amazing with all the history that surrounds the area. Be prepared for some hiking around. It was very windy up there the day we visited. If you are a history buff you must stop here.

Signal Hill was an awesome hike. It was raining the day we hiked, so not the best of conditions. My husband and I are not hikers and not in the best of shape. The hike down was not bad, but we didn't find the path back up so we ended up walking on the sidewalk along the road which was...
A great hike, beautiful views - bring a camera! I enjoyed the gift shop at the top too. Be aware that the fog rolls in, and then you can't see much. If it is clear then go!

When we went up there was so much wind and we were blown everywhere! nevertheless it was an amazing view and the signposts with how far it was to cities across the world was interesting, and hey, its free!
A must do while in St. John`s. Great sight of city and Atlantic Ocean.Great spot for whale and iceberg spotting
Historical, great view but if you're a hiker it will be amazing. Great photo ops. There's even a gift shop if you're so inclined to buy some souvenirs but it's not at all tacky.
We drove to the top and walked around the paths. The gift shop is small but had some lovely jewelry and a lot of touristy souvenirs.

I sat at the top of the hill and watched whales all morning long. You can hike up to the hill and then once you get there you can explore along the trails. It is so peaceful and breathtaking. Don't miss Signal Hill while in St. John's.

My wife and I hiked up to Signal Hill from the Battery using the Parks Canada trail. It was quite steep and had lots of stairs to get you over the rocks. It was well worth the walk as the views were fantastic and the Cabot Tower is very interesting. We were fortunate to be on the top of the...

My boyfriend and I went to signal hill in May, It must have been after the lighthouse was closed because we couldn't get in, however the view from the top is gorgeous, the lighthouse is kept in excellent condition and we enjoyed walking around the trail very much. Excellent and quick bit exercise!

Very informative! We walked the trail from Battery Rd. up the hill. Highly recommend doing this. Was amazing! All up hill so make sure you wear your walking shoes.

Great view of St John's.A must to visit, but dress warm, as it is very windy.If you can, hike around Signal Hill. Great work out!

A must but if the weather is cold and windy dress warmly. We were there on a day when temp. was 3C and windy. But the view of St John"s was worth the visit. Take your camera. Makes you think of history amd Mr. Marconi sending the first wireless messageRudyLora Bay Canada

I have hiked this many times since 2006 as often as I can per visit. I am in my late 50s with a trick knee. I know exactly the spot a previous poster noted as being unsafe but as many other posters noted we have to take responsibility for our behaviours. There is no danger if you stay on the...
Beautiful view. Windy the two days up there. Long walk up hill but worth it. The staff knowledgeable. The stairs in side signal very narrow.

Loved the view of the harbour and the city from Signal Hill. There's a trail that goes around the place but it was really chilly when we were there so we were not able to try. Would definitely recommend to visitors.
..Especially if you run up the footpaths like I did. Spectacular scenery and fresh air that will lift you up and fill you with inspiration.

Visitors must go to Signal Hill. Great views and photo ops and a great walk. Everytime I visit I come up to Signal Hil. Definitley a must do in St. JOhn's. Especially when the sun is out - make sure to go because the fog can roll in here at a moments notice and you won't get any good photos!
Signal Hill is steeped in history and has breathtaking views. Be prepared for high winds and bring warm coats/sweaters for the cold temperatures coming off the ocean.

My husband and I enjoyed a chilly trip around the trails at the top of St. John's. The views were spectacular and the grounds are well maintained. There is also a pleasant little gift shop with the Marconi Museum - a great place to take refuge from the wind for a bit.

This was a must see experience while in St-John's. Beautiful views of the Narrows, Cape Spear and the city of St-John's. Surrounded by lovely picturesque trails. Wear good shoes, bring your camera and feast your eyes!
Signal Hill is a nice place to stay. The view over the harbor and the town of St. John's are very good. But where there is a parking in this town?

A better view awaits you at Cape Spear...Not a hike to be attempted by the faint of heart.Appreciate the explanatory signs littered a little throughout the site: always helps to put historical significance within a context.Worhwhile if you want to get a good shot of St Johns Cityscape for your photo album.

I so enjoyed visiting Signal Hill. The views are incredible and the history is fascinating. I did the whole walk back around the hill to the city, and loved it. Take your time and walk to Signal Hill (I stopped at the Eco-Center) but my hubbie the history buff continued to the top and really enjoyed learning about it and took lots of pictures to show me what I missed :-)

If you are in St Johns, you must visit Signal Hill. You will have the most incredible views across the ocean and city, and can take walks around the cliff edges from simple strolls to hours of trails. Was there today to take some pictures. This is an awesome place, well located and full of history. You have a great view on the City of St John's... its the best view possible.Let's get up there, its free and a good place to do excercise.
I usually come here after a days work to just relax and also reflect. It has good walking trails and the Ocean and Harbour View are very nice.

Went to Newfoundland the summer of 2012 and I vow to return. Not just because of my experience in Signal Hill, but because of the memorable sights, food and vistas this fine province has to offer. Nice ti take your tea or coffee and drive up early to watch the sunrise! A friend of mine does it often and enjoys the experience. The walk up to Signal Hill from downtown St Johns takes about 20-30 minutes, depending on the number of 'breathers' taken! Yes, it's uphill pretty much all the way, so a great workout. The reward at the top is the outstanding views of the coast line, the harbour and the city. There are also great, well maintained trails branching out...

The views of both the ocean and the city are incredible. It's a very peaceful place to enjoy a cup of coffee while watching the sunrise, and a great hiking spot if you're looking for some short trails with great scenery (there are some steep inclines so expect a good workout!)
Marconi sent the first trans Atlantic message from here, worth seeing for this alone as you take a picture on your cell phone and email it instantly to London.

We had a delightful tour at the visitors centre. Video, fight re-enactment and posters. It was very enlightening to learn about the various battles that had been won and lost at this site. Yes the view from the top next to Cabot Tower is fantastic. There are also various ways to walk up, down and around this mound. There are...

Every time I come to St. John's on business, I make a point of walking up Signal Hill and, conditions permitting, walk down the front side and back to the city through the Narrows. It is an unbelievably gorgeous walk - the walk up is a true cardiac workout but well worth it! Don't miss it!

The road to get here was great and easy to find. Once there the trails to walk on were very well maintained and great to walk on. We were here for St. Paddy's day so the weather was quite cool and we never got to explore the rest of the trails.

If your feeling adventurous walk up signal hill for a start. once your up the parking lot alone offers a fantastic view of the Atlantic, where in May and June icebergs and the occasional whale too. once inside you get history of Signal Hill, including its military usage, and where Marconi sent the first wireless transmission across the Atlantic.

Signal Hill is so beautiful. Wonderful spot to just take a walk during the summer. Its great to be able to see the Ocean, Harbour and the beautiful city of St. John's and how much it has grown. Its even more beautiful at night!!! Worth the visit!!!
Great experience looking to Ireland from Canada. But, just like government, do not take advantage of their position.
If you like hiking, there are several trails around Signal Hill. They can be challenging however, so be warned.

This is a great stop for anybody who visits St. John's. Even if you don't take the trail to the top of the hill from the city, you can get some exercise climbing the stairs up Cabot Tower to see the view from above. Whales and icebergs as far as the eye can see! Best view of St. Johns, great hike for fit travelers .
If fresh air and a feast for the eyes is what you crave then Signal Hill has all of that plus a coastal hiking trail over ancient stone.
- nice hike with beautiful views- nothing spectacular, but perfect spot to get some exercise and have a good view of the city harbour
Watching a boat heading off st john's harbour to the lovely view of the ocean. This is a place where you go and clear your minds.

The views of the Narrows, the Atlantic, and St. Johns city are truly incredible up here. The smell of the sea air and watching the ships go in and out of the Harbour through the narrows was great! What a great place to use as the landmark for commencing my cross Canada road trip. It was warm and sunny while I was there, the views were awesome. The fog held off till I was ready to leave, some day I hope to be back. I was last here Jun 2011 but the trip adviser no longer lets me...
Spectacular view in any weather, but make sure to see it at night, arriving at dusk and watching as the city lights up at night! Wonderful romantic experience and must see before leaving "The Rock".
Great to see St John's at night. And go back again during the day to enjoy the hikes. The building is interesting with lots of history. Sign Post was fun to read

I was in St. Johns in June of 2012 and Signal Hill was one of my favorite parts of the trip. If the weather permits, the views are so beautiful! You can see the entire city on one side and the ocean on the other. There are also numerous trails to walk on the hill that were enjoyable. I would...

I love Signal Hill, and go back every time I come to Newfoundland. The trails and views are unparalleled, the natural geography is stunning, and the wind might just blow you over! It's colder on Signal Hill than the rest of St. John's, so dress accordingly, especially if you want to look and not hike.
So peaceful to be near the ocean! Great hiking trails that will definately give you a good workout or just sit at the top and relax with a coffee!!

We went in the winter but luckily the trails were clear so we hiked down to the end of the cliff and back. It was very cold but worth every step. The views were amazing and to see Newfoundland from such high up was breathtaking. Deffinatally worth it
Always a must see in St. John's. A beautiful view of the city stretches out in front of you. At sun set it is especially lovely.

We walked up from our hotel downtown and it was quite a hike but well worth it once you get to the top of the hill. As we were up there a ship came in through the narrows into St. John's harbour and that was way cool to see.

Amazing views and a MUST see if you are visiting St. Johns. I hiked from Duckworth St all the way around and took trails down alongside into old St Johns. I wish I brought my running shoes, I'd love to have jogged it.

Signal Hill is just one of those things you have to do when you go to St.John's and 'check' off the list. We didn't spend much time here but you can get the sense with the visitor centre and geological centre nearby that this is a tourist trap. We went off-season so the gift shop was thankfully closed. It was...

If you are fit enough, walk up the hill, enjoy all the trails, and spend time in the Interpretation Centre of this majestic fort and national heritage site.On you way back down, be sure to spend time at the EcoCentre.
Wonderful views of St John's and also along the coast to Cape Spear.Well worth walking up the Cabot Tower to get an even higher perspective.Next time we'll walk the trail!

If you are visiting St. John's, make sure you have time to visit Signal Hill. In fact, you should probably plan a trip to St. John's to see it. Did the hike around the new Signal Hill Park and took some photos on the lookout. The new lookout behind the Visitor's Centre is a must. I can't wait to go back in the night to see the lights of the city and harbour.

Foggy but really nice. We drove up at night to see the lights of St. John's, beautiful view, of what we were able to see.
amazing view of the city, go check it out after dark to get a spectacular view of St John's lights, streets and local sights

Lovly historic site and a must see for visitors. The sun was shining and the skies clear when I visited so the panoramic view was just fabulous. The wind has a voice that high and it's much cooler so dress appropriately and wear comfortable footwear. You can make a real hike of the place.

Terrific view from here and the weather when we were there was like a beautiful, cloudless summer day.

Views of the City of St. John's and the harbour entrance are fantastic. Good place to view icebergs in the spring. Lots of history here with Marconi having broadcasted the first trans-atlantic wireless message.
Not to be missed if in St. Johns. Best views of the city from the harbour side. The gift shop was well stocked and very friendly.
Wow! The views are spectacular. It's easy to find and close to town. There is so much history. Windy!!
You look out over open ocean on one side and over the city on the other side. You can see whales when in season and also a great place to view icebergs. Dress warm because it is always windy.

We walked up from our B&B on a cloudy day. It was SUPER windy when we got up there, but such an amazing historical site. Read all the little boards and hit up the visitor center if you can.
