Great views and a alot of history! We really enjoyed our visit here. Check the weather forecast before you go. It was foggy the day we arrived and waited for the first clear day, glad we did!

Signal Hill is a great place to drive up and look out over the ocean, or look back over all of St. John's. I did not enter Cabot Tower. I went late afternoon, so the sun was right my eyes as I tried looking out over St. John's and the harbour so, if you're after some good photos, go earlier....

I recommend you go both during the day and the night. Lovely vistas of the harbour, surrounding hills, and seaward during the day. At night, the lights of St. John's are beautiful. Very romantic spot. And, if you are lucky, the sunset behind the city will amaze you.
Loved the trails....though some were a little scary!!!Views were truly spectacular.History was most interesting!
Love the view from all sides, great tower, great info signs posted all around. trails all around. cute gift shop
St. John's is tiny. Signal Hill is something you do. It's a 3 min drive from the Geo center. a must do
High atop Signal Hill you can imagine the ships entring the harbour and the importance of identifying friend from foe! Gorgeous and historic.
Great place to go. I am 77 years old and had a hard time walking up the hills but it was a great view, The weather was very good and we could see all around Signal Hill . Worth the walk up the Hill.
A great place to enjoy fabulous views. Good parking, definitely a must to visit. We were lucky to have clear weather and one could see 360 degrees around!

The view from Signal Hill is amazing. We hiked down the paths and even though I walk a lot, it was challenging. Every day while I was in St. John's, we hiked up the roadway and down the cliff facing the water. The views were breathtaking.

There's a fabulous view from Signal Hill, but it's even better if you take the walking trail, which hugs the cliffside, to the top. From there you get a panoramic view of St. John's, as well as the Atlantic. Apparently Signal Hill got its name from the fact they used to run the flags of the incoming boats up, so...

Beautiful area, close to the great Johnson Geocenter, can explore safely all around the area, can walk to town if energetic. Thought the gift shop was very good. Many excellent vantage points for photos, and spots some people probably miss such as the ladies lookout. Do not miss!

Think about this! Wireless LAN has been done here before you know the name!This is a place full of history and a strong wind is showing you who is the master!The view to the harbor is spectacular. Best feature is probably panoramic views from the top of the hill, but there is also an interesting little guided walk around the knoll that relate St. John's history. A more extensive trail system emanates out from the hill, but there are more interesting walks in the area.
This was aplace that was very informative and the views were brilliant. It told the history of St Johns and the wars that went on between France and Britain.
Interesting musuem. The view was nice. A nice gift shop. The tour guide could have added more to the visit.
I was not aware of the importance placed on the Port of St.Johns.The visit was very informative and the view of the port and the ocean was really something.
Everyone who goes to St. John's has to do Signal Hill. It has one of those great views of St. John's and out into the ocean. Tres cool for anyone who wants an amazing view!
Leave your car at the hotel and walk from the town center. take the path following the harbour and walk all around to climb to the top of the hill. the view is impressive.
This was one of the best historic sites ever!We enjoyed walking the trails and reading the information. It was very windy and cold so bring a sweater!

Walked to the top of Signal Hill before breakfast to clear my head after a night on George St. A great half hour hike up well worth the view and an interesting overview of the Cabot and his discovery of America.

Amazing view from the top of the hill, you can look out over St. john's in one dircetion and out over the ocean in the other direction. You can hike a trail that winds right along the cliff, it's pretty amazing, takes you through a lane of houses at the base of the hill.
What's great about Signal Hill is the history as well as the hiking trails all around. Plan to spend a few hours here to soak up all there is to do.

The weather could have been nicer but that's true virtually no matter where you go. the view was still nice, and we stopped at the Geo Centre on our way up, which was perfect to take a break on the mini climb up the hill

beautiful scenery. Very accessible. Hikeable from downtown St. John's. Late August, hemp yourself to the blueberries!
This attraction was Excellent and spiritual! Going up to that mountain was like praying to God! Signal Hill,God bless you!
it was a beautiful view of the city and a great hike. not for the faint of heart. make sure to take your camera. great photo ops

It is a great feeling of accomplishment to climb the hill and a great view at the top but the building is nothing special. This is a must to do, walk it if you can, drive if you must.

As a Newfoundlander and nature lover, I have been visiting Signal Hill for many years.Signal Hill is a challenging hike that helps me to remember how special our island truly is. Exhilarating hikes, great views, lots of history. The best walk is from the top and down many steps to overlook Fort Amhurst and then continue round the cliff to The Battery. An exhilerating hike if you need to walk off some Cod Tongues and Scruntchons (sp.?). Stops at the Geo and Visitors' Centres make for good and informative breaks.

When you visit Signal Hill, make sure to pay the small admission fee and have a tour of the visitor centre. The movie alone is worth the admission price. Signal Hill is easily accessible from downtown St Johns and give a beautiful view of the harbour and coastline.

Great views on the hill, but even more fun is the trail that goes down from Signal Hill and curves back to the city, following the harbour entrance. Got to see Signal Hill on a tour of the area's main attractions. Neat to see...had heard a lot about it.
If you are tourist in St. John's, this is a must. Great view of a special city. The history is impressive.

Very cool to see. The view of the city is great!!! Wished we could have walked the trail that was around the coastline.

Great photo opportunities and views of St John's and and the Harbour. There are lots of walking trails along the ocean but be careful...no railing! It's a must-see tourist attraction in the lovely city of St. John's!
Definitely something you want to do if you go to St. John's! Lots of great spots to take pictures. Fun place to hike!
Gorgeous views of the city and sea and interesting history to the tower to explore. It is very windy (!) up there so bring a sweater or jacket and definitely tie back long hair!

It is right in St John's . So it is a must see and.costs nothing . To do it you have to do the stairs down to the water and then look up to the building.. The view of St John's from the tower was great.

Great experience..the view is astonishing and the plaques with written history scattered throughout adds a nice touch

Signal Hill is very well done, right down to the movie about its history. Try to walk down the stairs as it is worth it. Hope for a day that is not too foggy because the photos are really worth it.

A must-do activity when visiting St. John's. Pick a clear day and be prepared to walk uphill. The view from the hill is magnificent.

Awesome, just best place ever you can will fell like your the king (or queen) of the world. My family and I loved it

Must do when in St. Johns. Really is the pinnacle of the city and worth the hike up. We took the direct route up the road and came down the more adventurous, winding path on the way down. When we first arrived in St. John's Newfoundland...in the evening, and checked into the Marriott Hotel overlooking the harbour...I was wondering what all the Hype was about. Good experience to understand the importance of how the harbor was protected. Beautiful view of "the narrows"

If you are into seeing incredible views, hiking, history then this place is for you! Panoramic views of St. John's awaits. See the old canons used to defend the harbor in times of war. Visited Signal Hill with an Ottawa Based Tour Group on June 26, 2012. The views from Signal Hill are truly amazing. You can see so much from the top of this cliff-look down on St. John's and its harbour, over towards Cape Spear, or over the great expanse of blue, blue ocean. Wonderful view of the city and the ocean. Good signage telling the history of the site.
Wonderful view of the Narrows and the city.Great easy hike up the trail from visitor centre.
What a great spot to take some pictures and breathe in the best air around!!!

First thing we did after recovering from our 4 am arrival. The walk is a killer uphill, but it's absolutely worth it. The video at the tourist centre is cheesy, but interesting. The view is phenomenal. The tower is beautiful. Definitely climb the hill!

The view from Signal Hill was absolutely beautiful! Also, the staff at the visitor's centre was very welcoming and patiently answered all our questions. And it was so close to St. John's.

it all began here the communication revolution!come visit the tower..........

Signal Hill is the most beautiful place in this world !,,, the view is outstanding. Peaceful and just a great place to think !

Signal Hill is one of the jewels in the crown of St. John's liveability. Gorgeous view and nice historic site and giftshop. Insane walking trails all around too, very nice.
